The service is great, whenever I call the front desk they are always able to answer my questions and send someone to help fix anything that I needed to get fix.  Definitely will be resigning my lease for next year. Plus my roommates are some of the coolest people I've met.

name: Destinee Penigar
text: I lived here the first two years they were open and I loved it! I moved from my dorm on campus and signed a lease as soon as I could. The furnishings are high-class and you can't beat the amenities. The maintenance crew and office staff have always been helpful and make it a fun and inviting place to live!

name: Ulla Compton
text: Campus Quarters made the leasing process quick and easy. Ms. Kenyatta made sure that we were squared away and our unit was up and running properly for the semester.

name: Paul Thompson
text: While i could list the ways you should Never Ever Ever live here.... But Parents or potential residents. I ask you just go up there on any random night and walk around the parking lot and complex. Notice how many lights dont work(a lot especially the back) and its hard to see even where there is light. Just ask yourself do you feel safe having your daughter live here for a whole year?

resp.text:
Paul - Campus Quarters sincerely apologizes for any concern you may have with the lighting at Campus Quarters and is more than willing to discuss these concerns in our office; however, we are not certain how to reach you as you are not a tenant at Campus Quarters.

We do want to respond to your comments and let you know that monthly light checks are done at Campus Quarters and burnt out bulbs are replaced at that time.  If you, or anyone notices bulbs that are not working you are more than welcome to come into the office or put in a work order and they will be replaced.  Our tenants wellbeing is a primary concern of ours and we do want to make certain that Campus Quarters is properly illuminated.  Campus Quarters also meets and/or exceeds the minimum lighting requirements as established by the State of Alabama and Mobile County.  Again, please do not hesitate to come in to the office to discuss your concerns.

Sincerely,

Campus Quarters

name: Kevin Kellner
text: I would recommend CQ!

resp.text: Thanks for the feedback Kevin!

name: Alli Wolfe
text: Management is terrible. Due to a mistake on their end that they admitted was their fault, I am now having to either REPAY the $500 pet deposit or get rid of my cat. I payed this deposit two years ago when I first adopted my cat. This is not the first time they have done this, this is just the first time the mistake has not been fixed. I should not have to pay for their mistakes, literally. This is not the first issue I've had with them this is just the first issue that has prompted me to write a review. Their only redeeming quality is the apartment units themselves. They are very spacious and cozy. Overall I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone. The management is too unorganized.

name: Jarrell Robinson
text: Couldn’t have picked a better place to live feels like home away from home.

name: Emorie Cote
text: Lived here for 3 years. Every problem I have had has been dealt with quickly. Really sad that I am leaving this great place!

name: Ashley Dutton
text: Campus Quarters is the ideal place for students to live. It's very convenient living so close to Campus, but still not having to live in a dorm. Management has been super helpful, and they're always willing to assist me with any problems.

name: Taylor Smith
text: Great place to live, fun environment with a great staff who genuinely cares!

name: Heather Askew
text: Great customer service & friendly staff ! Also very close to South so commute isn’t too bad to class !

name: britney thompson (brat)
text: this is the worst thing i’ve ever gotten myself into. this is the worst place to live. it’s dirty, the washer & dryer doesn’t work, HIDDEN FEES, & lies lies lies!!!! they have us trapped in a lease.

name: Alli Bell
text: I love living at Campus Quarters! Everyone in the front office is so nice and helpful with moving in, and answers any questions I have. Highly recommend!

name: Haley Howell
text: I love my apartment! :) I moved here mainly to get a kitchen (I was tired of dorm life), but I am really loving my apartment for so much more than that. The office started being open on Saturdays again, and that is also helpful!

name: Anil Mangal
text: Worst experience I have ever had of this so called “apartment complex”. Let me tell you that these people will squeeze every single penny out of you with overages. Upon moving in the apartment was filthy covered in mold, pet fur from the previous tenants, and dust. This “luxury style” apartment, in my opinion, should be no comparison to other residential apartments that I have stayed at such as The Grove, The District, and many more. If you are in college to party and do drugs this is the place for you. You will smell Marijuana continuously throughout the day and night everywhere throughout the apartment. Do not stay here if you are planning on sleeping whatsoever. Constantly getting bogus overages for charges that were not my responsibility was a major issue. One instance Was trash leftover in the balcony that was not mine, was fined heftily for this. Being fined for leaving a trash bag for less than 30 seconds while going back inside and getting my car keys was another 50 bucks. This does not come close to the most ridiculous and idiotic scheme i have ever heard. They tried to fine me for having aluminum foil on my window 😂 this has to be one of the most poorly managed, un organized place that i have ever stayed at. Want to talk to a manager about issues? Good luck! You’ll wait over 4 hours on the phone trying to get in contact with even the slightest person of authority. Everyone in the office has a piss poor attitude and the maintenance people take years to arrive and even fix the issue. The staff is nothing but ignorant college kids. If you want to stay in mobile and you are a student, do yourself a favor and get yourself an apartment at literally any other place in mobile. Another huge issue was the roomate situation. After having a terrible roomate leave, another even worse roomate arrives UNNOTICED!! By being assured that they would interview me if another roomate arrived, another roomate arrived surprisingly unnanounced. This has to be the most terrible and unprofessional establishment that is in Mobile. Please do yourself a favor, if you are a parent and you want your son or daughter to thrive and be successful in college, do not let him/her live here. You will be stuck in paying overpriced unreasonable rates to these clowns.

name: Marianne Castleberry
text: My daughter talked me into her moving into Campus Quarters....and we have had several problems.  Now, they actually think we (mom) is going to pay for a fine for leaving a garbage bag outside the door (back hallway) until it stopped flooding rain.  Several maintenance items inside the apartment have either not been fixed or took weeks to get completed.  I have called the office only to speak to a staff member that had to take another message.  Finally the "new" property manager called me over 24 hours later.  Did  not resolve anything.  Did not remove the charge.  They are gouging the student in this area.  I am contacting Corp as well today.

resp.text: Hi Marianna, thank you for your review and feedback. I apologize for your frustration with our community. Could you please reach out to residentconcerns.com and one of our senior management team will be in touch. Thank you,

name: Blaine Cardwell
text: I had a great experience here at Campus Quarters. The management was really good, the people in the front were very helpful!! Highly recommend.

name: Haley Johnson
text: Upon move in our apartment was absolutely disgusting with dead bugs in the freezer, trash on the ground in the rooms, a sticky substance seeping up from the carpet in my bedroom, an entire box of old Krispy Kreme doughnuts under my roommate’s bed, and dried food on the kitchen walls despite renters being required to pay a $65 cleaning fee when moving out (where did that money go?) Maintenance takes a very long time (if they help at all), so expect up to 3 weeks to fix your issue. Noise complaints are generally disregarded unless a large party is going on at night. The living room is very spacious and the appliances are nice, but this can be found at other complexes near campus. My roommates and I tried many many times to get the staff to help clean the mess that was left in our rooms (or at least fix the carpet), and each time we ask for an update on our request, we either don’t get a response, or they say our request was cancelled (or nonexistent). To avoid the hassle, I’d just go somewhere more professional.

name: Clancy Carlisle
text: Great place to live! I've lived here for over a year and plan to continue living here until i graduate from south! The office staff is very helpful!

name: Stanley Brewer
text: Very unhelpful daughter changed majors and transferred closer to home. They could care less about helping to get someone for the lease. Would advise to look elsewhere

name: Allison Yaron
text: Campus Quarters is a great place to live and in a great location! It's so convenient to campus.

name: FreeToFly 16
text:
If I could have given this place NO stars, I totally would have. However, I HAD to choose something. This place is a sorry excuse for “Luxury Student Living”. I had so many issues in my time here.
So, upon getting my keys and finally getting to go look, I went in and did my little checklist when I noticed that there were very gross yellow and green stains on the base boards behind my toilet. They came and cleaned it, no problem. (still disgusting)
Then the AC went out in the MIDDLE of the summer. It got up to almost 85 degrees in there if I remember correctly. Took maintence almost 2-3 days to come and assist. (Only for it to happen again a few months later)
*ATTENTION PET OWNERS* If you have a dog with ANY types of social anxiety, this is NOT the place for you. They have a “leash law” in their lease stating that all dogs must be on leashes at all times. BUT 99% of the people that live there DO NOT follow this rule. Their dogs run away from them and don’t listen when their owner calls. I had my dog ATTACKED right in front of my apartment one day from someone not having their dog on a leash. Management did nothing but send out a small email about it.. and getting your $250 back from your deposit takes up to 4-5 months to come to you.
Now, I need to get this out there so you guys can see what kind of people they hire. One day, I heard BANGING on my door.  It took me all but about 3 seconds to get there before they were already unlocking my door and coming in. I get to the door, and my dog is doing what he does best and investigating the people coming in his home. He comes up with a toy in his mouth and sniffs their feet, very friendly,wagging his tail. THEN the guy that was with a girl to do the inspection, puts his hand on my dog’s chest and SHOVES him back(20 lbs dog) and tells me to “watch my dog...” From there, this man straight up went in my room, opened all of my drawers to my chest of drawers, all of my cabinets in my bathroom, snooped in my closet, and did the same exact thing to my roommate’s room as well and left EVERY light on and EVERYthing open. NOT TO MENTION they are supposed to email you a notice about inspections. I did NOT get one for that day or hardly any others.
Them being able to come in if someone doesn’t answer the door is just a huge invasion of privacy in my opinion. Imagine getting out of the shower or being IN the shower and not being able to hear your door being knocked on and someone comes in your apartment.. a stranger at that.
Towing has a $250 fine PLUS its like a 30-45 minute drive to the super sketchy, very obviously cheap towing company where the staff is insanely rude.
OVERAGES. Always, always about 20-30 dollars in overages every single month. No matter if you weren’t there for all of a month (like December for example… Christmas time)
So, I moved out at the beginning of March in a rush to leave that place for multiple reasons. I get a call (in July) from management saying that there is a HUGE mold issue in my apartment due to “excessive moisture”. I cleaned my apartment from head to toe before I left. Down to vacuuming, sweeping and mopping. And left it just how I found it, except probably better. I received pictures, and the mold is EVERY where… ceiling, baseboards, couch, chair, walls.. you name it. And they are blaming ME for it. It is all due to the AC closet in my bedroom that has an oddly direct flow from outdoor air. I even mentioned that I had turned my air off to someone at the front desk before I left and was told, and I quote, “Oh that’s perfectly fine! No problem!” Now, If I hadn’t had the overage problem the whole time, I would have left it on anyways. But I just do not see the point in paying overages for not living there in the first place.
PLEASE read these comments, guys. They WILL rob you of your money... DO NOT DO IT. Paying this much (about 1400 for a small two bedroom apartment w/ overages) with this much of a hassle just to be so close to South is NOT worth it. Clock an extra 10-15 minute drive and live somewhere much better and worth your time and money.

resp.text: Hi FreetoFly16 - Thank you for your review and feedback. We want to ensure that we address all of your concerns in person with our onsite managemnt team and our corporate management. Please reach out to the main office to schedule a meeting, or please complete a entry at www.residentconcerns.com. We appreciate your feedback and look forward to discussing with you soon. Sincerely, WE Communities

name: Devon Franzel
text: I have lived at Campus Quarters for two years now and every time I have had a problem it has been fixed in a very quick manner. The office staff has always been extremely helpful as well whenever there is a problem. I would recommend Campus Quarters to anyone looking for off-campus housing.

name: Susan Sumrall
text:
Where do I begin??? It asks us to rate it with a star, and I cannot figure out why there aren't any stars on the negative side of zero.  My daughter moved in there for college 2 years ago this past August and at first all seemed fine, but as time went by my thoughts on that changed.  My daughter was charged overages every single month and there was never an understanding as to why.  Maintenance would pop in whenever they wanted without any kind of a notice and I do mean POP in.  We got something for her door so she couldn't be surprised unannounced again.  She decided to move out towards the beginning of the year.  She was paid up in rent, so as soon as she found her a better place she moved all of her belongings out and cleaned the apartment from top to bottom.  The apartment was 100% clean and ready  for a new tenant.  My daughter turned the air off when she left because that's what one does when no one will be living there.  Fast forward maybe 2-3 months..........She gets a lengthy letter from them demanding $7,000 in damages because of mold!  Her little apartment had mold from ceiling to floor, all on the walls, in the cabinets, in the toilet, all over the furniture, everywhere!   Any and everywhere was covered in mold.  It was unbelievable!  Her ex-roommate sent her pictures and I'm here to tell you it was disgusting,  but it was not my daughter's wrong doing or fault that caused this.  I am not one to bad mouth anyone, but if the shoe fits, you wear it!!  My question is what is wrong with a buildings structure or inner walls to make a room become so overwhelmingly engulfed in mold in such a short period of time?  What has been behind these walls all this time?  Is this why my daughter's nose stayed stopped up?  Is this why she was always sneezing?  Lots of questions are coming to mind.  I could understand if my daughter was being negligent or irresponsible, but that simply is not the case here.  They are now holding us responsible for their problem.  Do NOT let your child live here.  It is NOT what it seems.  The people who consider themselves to be "in charge" take advantage of our children because they know that most children straight out of high school are easily mis-lead and easy to screw over.  They figured wrong when speaking about my daughter.  So many kids live here and the bills are paid without question from "mama and daddy's" bank account, and most parents don't even think or ask to see a bill probably.  I wonder how much money they make in one month alone in overages??  Imagine how much in a year.  It's ridiculous!  Do yourself and your child a favor and look elsewhere.  Oh!!! and don't be fooled by the good reviews from the tenants.  That's the new ones who were promised a little gift card for writing a good review.
Susan Sumrall

name: Gabriella Vegliacich
text: My experience at Campus Quarters has been great so far. This is my first year living here as a junior and it's the best apartment complex I've lived in so far since I started at USA. Besides one hiccup with a broken item in my room, they are very patient and ready to get things done.

name: William Harris
text: apartments are super nice. love the pool and fire pit. staff is awesome.

name: Kyle Ford
text: lived here for all 4 years of school and never had any issues. Would recommend CQ to anyone

name: Shafi Qureshi
text: Extremely inadequate management. The manager has ignored and consistently lied to her tenants about excessive fees that seem to come out of nowhere. She has given false information on leasing and continues to profit off of her tenant’s inability to pay on time, resulting in late fees which always fluctuate. Her (K) position should thoroughly  be reconsidered for the sake of future residents. Saddened by her greed and lack of professionalism. Will not recommend, even As a last resort.

name: Heather Mead
text: I am writing a review as a parent. This apartment complex take advantage of the students. My daughter signed a lease and wasn’t allowed to see the room and was charged from begging of month tell the 18th (not prorated) when only allowed to move in on 18th at 11 am , promised a clean room but the apartment was filthy and stained. I am the grantor for her filthy over priced one room and it makes me sad they present as well as still take advantage of he students inexperiance.

resp.text: Hi, Heather - thank you for your review. We apologize we did not meet your expectations, but would be happy to walk you through the lease agreement and explain every aspect to you and your daughter. We will have our general manager reach out to you tomorrow, as well as our senior corproate management team. Thank you, and have a wonderful day.

name: Celine Decatrel
text: If you want maintenance to barge into your apartment 5 days before move out and have them take all of your roommates things without her knowing, signing anything about moving out early, or turning in her keys... go ahead and move in. I’ve been here for 3 years and there’s been a lot of little things like random matienece enterance without notification, loud neighbors, people smoking weed, and people having screaming fights. Don’t even bother calling the curtesy officer because they can never get a hold of them. I would never recommend someone to live here. Just get a real apartment instead.

name: EJ Turner
text: Would not recommend. Front office is generally unhelpful in almost all cases you call them about. It is hit or miss if you will get someone out to fix things that need to be fixed in a timely manner. My cable and internet was down for about a week and a half before anything was done. The biggest thing though is the fact that they will scam you out of "overage" charges. Within the first week I moved in they tacked on an overage charge and I had not even been there long enough to even get one. We did not change anything differently when it came to using power and did not have one for the next couple months then all of a sudden we are hit with overage charges of 30 dollars the next six or seven months in a row. The people giving it good reviews either had not lived there that long yet or work there. Save yourself the hassle and either find another apartment complex, live on campus, or find a cheap house to rent out with friends.

resp.text: EJ: Good afternoon, and thank you for your review. We apologize that we did not meet your expectations of being part of our community, and understand your frustrations. We will be reaching out to you today to discuss your billing concerns, your account, and see how we can be of assistance. Thank you again for your review. ~ Your Campus Quarters Team

name: Laquesha White
text: I really love Campus Quarters especially move in day. Everything was so smooth, the process was quick and the staff was very helpful.

name: Mason P
text: Great amenities, staff is really helpful. fun place to live

name: Stacy Dukes
text: DO NOT MOVE TO THIS COMPLEX!!! THEY HAVE MAJOR ISSUES AND WILL NOT RESOLVE THEM.. MY DAUGHTERS MOVED IN ALMOST 2 WEEKS AGO STILL NO CABLE,, (WHICH IS INCLUDED IN THE RENT)... THE CEILING FANS DO NOT WORK, AND MANAGEMENT IS NOT IN A RUSH TO DO ANYTHING ABOUT IT.. YOU CAN LEAVE A MESSAGE BUT GOOD LUCK IN GETTING SOMEONE TO RETURN YOUR CALL .. DON'T BE FOOLED. THIS IS NOT AN ELITE PROPERTY...  THE PICTURES MAY LOOK NICE BUT YOUR EXPERIENCE WILL BE HORRIBLE, GARBAGE... A MISTAKE.. --THIS IS THE PLACE IF YOU WANT HEADACHES, AFTER HEADACHES!!!!!

resp.text: Stacy, Thank you for expressing your concerns. We strive to provide an excellent experience for all of our residents at Campus Quarters, and your feedback is vital to our focus on achieving these goals.  Please call our offices at (251) 202-5204 to discuss your account. Thank you, and have a wonderful day! ~ Your Campus Quarters Team

name: Carson Davidenko
text: Campus Quarters is a wonderful place to live! Great amenities and very friendly staff always available to meet your needs!

name: Bailey Duos
text: Campus Quarters is nothing but a greedy money pit. Sure, the apartments are okay and the staff are SOMETIMES okay, but they only want your money. That's it. And they will take every penny of it with no problem. I suggest going somewhere else if possible and not getting roped into a place like this. There's plenty of nice apartments that care about their residents and don't drive them out by nickeling and diming everything they do. Also, the employees are the only ones who rate this place 5 starts because they're required to. Don't fall for it.

name: Brandy Abbott
text: Great place for students. Lots of give aways

name: Jason Borcz
text: I love living at Campus Quarters, I was a transfer from Trinity University in San Antonio, Texas to South to be closer to my family and I had heard great things about Campus Quarters, it is the best off-campus student housing complex around!

name: Joseph Turek
text: I have lived here for 3 years since I moved off of campus and the office staff is great and I love my roommates

name: wes riley
text: Campus quarters is a great place to live with very friendly people

name: Emma B
text: Sago palms everywhere!!!!!! They poison dogs!!! When I first moved in some girl told me to be careful of my dog around those palm bushes bc she heard they’re harmful. I didn’t really think anything of it and I didn’t know what they were called so I couldn’t google it. I figured it was like chocolate, like don’t feed it to your dog but a little but won’t really hurt them. Wrong. 7 months after living here my dog started having seizures one night and had to go to the ER Vet. She almost died. Had to stay over night. The vet bill was tremendous of course. It was bc she ingested like barely any of the sago palm root. Since then I’ve heard of other ppl who’ve had a similar experience. Someone’s dog died. You’d think they wouldn’t have a plant so toxic to dogs on both sides of every sidewalk at an otherwise very pet friendly apartment complex. Other than that idiocy, it’s a decent place to live.

name: Ryan W
text: Terrible place to live

name: Jessica Comeaux
text: Most of the other five star reviews you see are clearly from either people who work at CQ or people who haven't lived at CQ for long. Giving two stars instead of one because the proximity to campus is a HUGE plus. Overall, management changes every couple of months and is generally unhelpful. This place is ultimately a money pit.

name: Martin Harden
text: WARNING THEY TOWE VISTORS WITHEN 30 MINS AND THE TOWING COMPANY IS 40 MINUTES AWAY WITH A $250 FINE PLUS GAS OF THE TOW TRUCK

name: Rebekah Johnson
text: If you’re forced to live in the Edge, the Grove or Campus Quarters, Campus Quarters is the ideal one; however I would never choose to live here again. Management doesn’t care about your problems, the free printing is a lie because it never is working, internet is always in and out, apartments are not clean before you move in and its just overall way too expensive for the crap you get. I wish I had chosen to stay elsewhere and I will not recommend it to anyone else. We shouldn’t be paying $2,000+ a month for the service we receive and none of the extras we were promised.

name: Colby Dannelley
text: Staff very friendly, and club house and pool is a great place to hang.

name: William Cebula
text: We were very pleased. Very clean complex. Management very responsive to our needs.

name: Imen Saunders
text: Clean atmosphere & sweet staff ❤️

name: Danuelle T
text:
I wouldn't recommend anyone staying here or thinking about moving in. This is no bashing this is HONESTY and real life experiences at Campus Quarters. They don't have a good staff at the front desk and they do not work with you under no circumstances when it comes to roommate issues and problems at your apartment. There has been a time where they lost my money order and told me to re-issue out another money order for their mistake and then didn't apologize or updated me on if they found it or not. They will say they will work with you and then renege on what they have said. I even spoke with the Headquarters that was over the entire complex and she hasn't complied or come to agreements with me on anything and there has been plenty of other students who were not satisfied with this complex and has left or is in the process of trying to leave. They are not elevated student living because anyone thats not a student can live here which going against they title of being a "elevated student living". If you dont believe anything I am posting stay there and find out for yourself but i highly suggest you save your kids the trouble and save your money and live anywhere but here. if you would like more information on the things ive been through just send me a message.Also I am currently in the process of leaving, couldn't find anyone that wanted to live in this chaotic and unprofessional place. Another thing they will sweet talk you into living here and then the rudeness and bullshit come along.

Sincerely,
An upset resident

name: Triston Davis
text: I’ve been staying in Canpus Quarters for the past couple years and by far the best student living apartments in mobile AL

name: Taylor Keel
text: Campus Quarters is very helpful and always fixes any problems i have, big fan of this apartment complex

name: Sam Cochran
text:
The only reason I left a positive review a while ago was to get points for this "Community Rewards" program that CQ had. Honestly I'm not sure why they got rid of it because it was probably the only good publicity they would get.
This review is kind of long, if you don't read the stories, at least read the last two paragraphs.

Within the first two months of living here, I realized that this place was awful. If I had this semester to do over again, I would definitely have opted for the hour commute each day. Seriously, even on-campus living would be better than here.

It feels like they could care less about your satisfaction once they have you locked in to a lease. There was a time a few months ago where I went 3-4 days without internet. (Internet outages happen really often here) I was working on a homework assignement when it just quit working. I figured out that it wasn't my router, but a problem with comcast (who were super helpful and friendly when  I called). Comcast told me that they see the problem but were unable to do anything about it unless they had an employee tell them to reboot. So I call CQ get transferred to someone saying they were the manager and explained to her what Comcast said only to be cut off and informed that it was a Friday afternoon and the office was closed. But I still paid for utilities that month, right? Oh well, they don't care.

Over Christmas break, my roommates and I were gone almost the entire month. When we left, we turned the AC and all the lights off and were still charged $20 overages a piece. How does that work?

Most recently, I woke up one Sunday to my air conditioning and fan not working. So I check the thermostat to see if I can fix it, nothing. Luckily my parents were coming over to visit that day so I asked my dad to make sure I wasn't doing something wrong on the thermostat, still wouldn't work. So we call CQ (seriously it's July and it's hotter in my apartment than outside) and ask for someone to come fix the AC. That was around 3:00pm Sunday. They said they'd have someone come out to look at it that day. No one showed up until the next morning when i got back from class around 10am. I had to sleep on my couch with 3 fans blowing on me (I've been on more comfortable camping trips). Got charged a huge overage for this too.

Oh and my favorite part is when the maintanance guy mentioned above comes in to fix my fan. He stands on a chair in my room and tells me to flip the switch. Nothing happens. Then he spins the fan with his and a few times and tells me to call if i have any more problems. I don't think he made it to his car before it quit spinning.

Seriously this place is a joke. Students reading this, you can do better. Parents, don't let your kids move somewhere they'll have this many problems with.

P.s. They go in your room whenever they please. Granted, they knock first, but I have heard them knock and go into my empty roommates' rooms before. Honestly, this makes me uncomfortable.  And this part might be too much information, but one day coming home from class I see one of the maintenance workers going door to door and it looks like he had just come out of my apartment. Myself or my roommates haven't been there all day, but when I go in, there was an unbearable smell. He had used my bathroom.

I'm sure not many people will take time to read this, but if I could tell you one thing it would be - when you come to visit try to come in and walk around the complex and ask people you see walking around their honest opinions and if they would recommend living here. I'd be willing to bet that there's more negative than positive answers.

name: Kathryn Hicks
text: Campus Quarters Apartments is a joke of an apartment complex. If you've considered living here, choose somewhere else immediately! I am still paying to live there and have my keys. Not only did maintence throw away all of my clothing hangers (not an exspensive belonging but still), they also have thrown away/stolen ALL of my necklaces I had hanging in my LOCKED room. I'm not due to turn in my keys for four days, yet they still claim to have access to throw any "nonvalubale" belongings away if the apartment "looks vacant". They have offered no refund and have been zero help as I am now without approx. $300 worth of jewelry. Please share this and let others know that is a poor example of a complex. So happy to say I WILL NOT be returning here this fall.

resp.text:
Kathryn – Campus Quarters sincerely apologizes for the breakdown in communication during the difficult time of move-out/turn/move-in. Upon the unit inspection by our maintenance team, your unit appeared abandoned, and although the official lease expiration had not transpired our staff treated the unit as if it had been abandoned, and followed protocol as listed in your original lease agreement, sections 2.19 and 2.21. We appreciate your feedback and can assure you we have taken the appropriate measures to ensure this does not happen to another tenant in the future.

Sincerely,

Campus Quarters

name: Oscar Mcmillian
text: Awesome place to stay with great prices

name: Tyler Smith
text: Great place and great people.

name: Deshown Moultrie
text: Campus quarters is by far the best student living available to south students.

name: Christin Cole
text: Great place & friendly staff!

name: Kayla Rodgers
text: Great atmosphere and amazing people!!

name: Tonnie Burton
text: Great place to live!

name: J Hink
text: DO NOT RENT HERE!  THEY TELL THE KIDS TO "JUST SIGN THEIR PARENTS NAMES"!  This place should be seriously looked into for fraudulent behavior and taking advantage of young college students. BEWARE BEWARE BEWARE

resp.text: Hi, J Hink - Thank you for your review. We take your comment very seriously, and would be happy to discuss your daughter's lease with you. Please contact our corporate office by providing your contact information at www.residentconcerns.com . We look forward to discussing your concerns and helping provide further information. name: Tim neal
text: Paid off bill which was around $3500 a year and half ago but recently received a bill for$6.53. Was told if not paid will be sent to collections. Only excuse I got was old management didn't catch it. I wouldn't recommend this place for anyone extremely over priced and people are very incompetent

text: Affordable and awesome!!

name: Robert Bourque
text: Great staff, nice amenities

name: Andrew Bonnett
text: Great place

text: My apartment was nice but far as management it's very unorganized, the managers change every couple months, they also don't keep their word, I discussed getting some late fees waived and she said it would be done but now since the manager I spoke with IS NOT THERE anymore they told me I have to call this and that place when I shouldnt have to go through all that....

resp.text: Hi Shakiriah, Thank you for expressing your concerns. The account you need assistance with was with the former owner and management company of Campus Quarters - in 2014. We encourage you to reach out to them to assist with this issue.  Thank you, and have a wonderful day! ~ Your Campus Quarters Team

name: Caleb Hoskins
text: Staff very nice

name: Austin Cross
text: I'd rather sleep on the corner of Dauphin street than move back into this place.

resp.text: Austin, We don't want you sleeping on the corner of Dauphin street, and we thank you for expressing your concerns. We strive to provide an excellent experience for all of our residents at Campus Quarters, and your feedback is vital to our focus on achieving these goals.  Please call our offices at (251) 202-5204 to discuss your account. Thank you, and have a wonderful day! ~ Your Campus Quarters Team

name: jonathan diamond
text: Great place to live!

name: Justin Raya
text: This apartment complex is one  of, if not the, best place for a college student to get an apartment. It is in close proximity to the University of South Alabama and the staff keep in mind that at least most of the tenants are students.

name: L Stein
text:
I needed to retire and move very quickly last fall from Indiana to Madison to help care for my grandchildren during this crazy pandemic.
Taylor Drake became my contact in finding an apartment quickly and efficiently at Madison Park apartments. She has been an absolute blessing walking me through all of the processes. Anytime I've had ANY questions throughout this past year, she has answered them courteously and  promptly. I know I can count on her for any help I may need. She is a fantastic model of what customer service is all about; she's a gem--don't lose her!! The apartment is wonderful! I love the layout of the space, the landscaping is just beautiful, the grounds are immaculate, and the pool is crystal clear... always! I've lived in many apartments across the U.S. and this has been the best!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind comments about Taylor, she is truly amazing and a key part of our Madison Park team! If there is anything we can help you with, please don't hesitate to reach out!

name: Ramsay Newman
text: Madison Park apartments makes everything easy. I love it here. been here for two years and did not have one issue. Taylor Drake in the front office is quick to respond and is very helpful.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words and continued residency here at Madison Park Ramsay! We will make sure Taylor hears your compliments.

name: Madhuri Pasupuleti
text:
I have been a resident @Madison Park Apartments since 2018. Great apartment, great maintenance, great ambiance, and most importantly, friendly staff ( Taylor and Kristen). They always greet me with a smile and are the best at what they do. The maintenance staff, Bill, is very helpful and fixes any maintenance issues like a pro.

Love my stay here. I would highly recommend this apartment.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words Madhuri, we appreciate your continuing to chose Madison Park as your home after all these years! We are extremely lucky to have Taylor, Kristen and Bill on our team and will definitely pass your compliments on.

name: Ashley Archey
text: I moved here from California and Taylor Drake has been wonderful! Any question I have she promptly answers without hesitation. The complex is kept up and looking beautiful. The apartments themselves are spacious. I had one with a sunroom made the apartment feel much bigger. I was nervous about bring my dog but he was welcomed with open arms which I appreciated! Thank you Taylor for all the awesome work you do!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words Ashley! We are glad that Atlas loves his new home. Taylor is great and we are very lucky to have her as part of our Madison Park team. If there is anything else we can do for you, please don't hesitate to reach out.

name: Conner Tyson
text: We have greatly enjoyed our time at Madison Park! The leasing process was great. Taylor went above and beyond when communicating with us about different lease options and pricing. I had LOTS of questions and she took the time to answer them all. The entire office staff is so pleasant and we are so glad we chose to live here!

resp.text: Thank you for choosing Madison Park as your home Conner! We look forward to the wonderful time you'll have as one of our residents here. We are so lucky to have Taylor at Madison Park.

name: Amber Winkles
text: This is an excellent community to live in. I couldnt say enough good things about Madison Park. I am new to this complex, but I have had noting but positive experiences here. The application process was easy and quick and I was called right away. Taylor and Kristen are WONDERFUL people and are so sweet. They are quick to help you and find a solution that works for you. The maintenance team is on point! The apartments are beautiful and clean. The community is peaceful and quiet. I love that there is a dog park for my baby boy to run and play. The grounds are beautifully maintained. There is ample parking and even a spot where you can wash and vacuum your car. The pool is beautiful and always clean. The list goes on and on. They really think about the residents and make sure we have plenty of what we need and are happy with our homes. If you are looking for an affordable apartment in Madison, this is the place to be! They are like family here and I love my new home. 💕

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words Amber! We are so glad you're enjoying your new home. We will pass your compliments to both our onsite and maintenance teams, if there is anything we can assist you with, please don't hesitate to reach out to our onsite manager.

name: Victoria Hawkins
text: I have loved my experience at Madison Park Apartments! There is an abundance of amenities, the apartments are spacious, and the staff is great! Especially Taylor Drake! Taylor has been so kind and is always so quick to respond and assist with all my questions! I am very happy that this is the place I landed when moving across country.

resp.text: We thank you for choosing to live at Madison Park Victoria! Your kind words are appreciated and we will pass the compliments along to Taylor. If there is anything we can do to continue to make your cross country move as smooth as possible, please don't hesitate to reach out!

name: Jessica O'Connor
text: I moved to Madison Park in 2019 and Taylor Drake at the leasing office was very accommodating and answered all of my questions. Since then I have not been disappointed with the service I have received from her or any of the other staff in the leasing office or maintenance. Also, the apartment itself is great and feels like home. I would recommend that anyone looking for an apartment in the area to at least check Madison Park out.

name: Rachel Sims
text:
Madison Park has been a great place to live temporary while we wait on our home to get finished! The amenities offered are very nice and the apartments are so spacious.
Everyone has been so friendly and the office staff and maintenance have been very helpful during our time.

resp.text: That's great to hear Rachel! Congratulations on the new home and please let us know if there is anything we can do to help.

name: T Parker
text: This is where I call home. Living here, I don't think ever want to buy a house. I love it here. It is so nice and quiet. The staff are amazing. Taylor and Kristen are so wonderful and so sweet. They are always willing to help in anyway. I love them. The maintenance guys, Bill N. and Michael K. are awesome. When I put a maintenance request in, it is completed within 24 hours. Even with Covid-19 happening, they get the job done with mask and gloves on. My air conditioner went out in my apartment, they replaced it with a new one. They also put a portable air conditioner in my apartment overnight until the parts came in the next day. These apartments are amazing. The neighbors are friendly, not mention it is gated. Home Sweet Home!

resp.text: That is so wonderful to hear Ms Parker. Having amazing residents like you is what makes our community so great. I will pass on your kind words to the team. And please continue letting us know if there is anything we can help you with!

name: B G
text: Madison Park has been my home for some time now and it is truly a wonderful place to live. The community is quiet and peaceful, community events are creative and fun, and the amenities offered . But what I truly appreciate about Madison Park is the incredible staff, particularly Kristen and Taylor! They have always been able to resolve any issues I may have had. They go above and beyond to enhance my living experience and have made it all the more enjoyable. If you're in need of a place to stay, Madison Park is the place to be!

name: Debbie Rogers
text: I LOVE these apartments esp how quickly Bill in maintenance responds to work orders.  I place a work order and  usually within half hour to hour (and most times quicker )  Bill has item repaired.  Thank you Bill. AWESOME job

resp.text: Wow, that is so great to hear Ms Rogers :) We appreciate you being part of the Madison Park community and will pass on the kind words!

name: Megan Marks
text: We have lived here for two years and had nothing but great experiences! The pricing is good, especially for the area. Taylor Drake, the assistant manager in the office, is awesome! She has always been such a big help and always has a smile on her face when I see her. She even helped me load a heavy package from the office into my car once! The office staff as a whole has always been friendly and welcoming, but Taylor goes above and beyond for the residents at Madison Park Apartments.

resp.text: Hi Megan, thank you for your residency with us! We love Taylor and will be sure to pass on your compliments :)

name: Angela G
text: People are fine but they post false pricing... It was posted an hour ago that they were 1260... They were 1410. When asked was told well nothing I can do about it... That is by definition false advertising.

resp.text:
Hi Angela,
We have investigated your concerns and do show our website correct and up to date. We apologize for your confusion. Our pricing does change daily depending on many factors. We wish you the best in your home search. Kind regards.

name: Di Schlabach
text: Super friendly Office!

name: Alecia Flint
text: I lived at Madison Park for 5 years and only moved due to relocation. The property is beautiful and well kept. Everyone I dealt with in the front office was always nice and helpful. Maintenance was quick and friendly also. I had a great experience. As someone who reads reviews in making my decisions I wanted to leave this one to help anyone looking to potentially move here. Do it, you won't regret it!

name: Alison Ditmars
text: I loved my experience getting our apartment here Kristen is awesome !!! And she had a smile and was so nice the whole time she was showing me the unit we move in September 14th and because of my experience with her I am so excited for this new adventure with my husband!!! Thank you Kristen for being so nice and taking the time to show me around

text: Overall I liked this place. Kristen was an absolute doll! Only complaint it our apartment had a tremendous amount of mold growth and I dont feel that it was properly treated at all!

name: Billie Hunter
text: Very nice complex.

name: Teresa Rivera
text: e. Place amazing staff.

name: Tyler Smoker
text:
I have lived here for a little more than 2 years.  The apartments are very nice and the management staff has always been nice. However, over the past couple months, it seems the residents that they are moving in are subpar.  Excessive noise at all hours of the day and night. Including people racing through the parking lot, people blasting their bass/music in their car to the point where I could hear lyrics inside my house with my doors and windows closed in my apartment, and inconsiderate, rude neighbors that when asking them politely to be a little more considerate, they shrug you off and go on about their rude and hateful ways.  I can not wait to move in 2 years when I get new orders to go somewhere else. Never living in an apartment again.

Edit: I've lived here for 2 years and a few months. I'd imagine someone could query on the last name to find what unit I live in.

resp.text: Hi Tyler, we would like to reach out to you to see if we can assist with issues you are having. However, we don't see you as a resident at Madison Park. Did you leave this review for the correct property?

name: JJ Jinright
text:
Amenities are nice,  but get ready for apathy from management on any issues and surprise fees. They got bought out in the last year and stopped caring. Fees that cant be rationally explained and the renters will always be at fault.

Edit: Previous tenants have fed local wildlife causing issues, with requests into management and no actions taken. Currently, I am learning that several residents have been affected by fees that were not communicated and the "fault" was pushed to residents. I did reach out to voice my concern, the response was A. We can ask corporate, but that's about it. B. Paraphrased: 'We can't keep up with when all of our residences information can expire resulting in a fee.' That's literally the job.

resp.text: It is great to hear you are enjoying the community amenities. We care very much and appreciate any feedback. We ensure all residents are treated fairly, with a priority of maintaining a clean and safe community. Current community fees are standard and transparent. Is there a specific fee you are confused about? Please don't hesitate to reach out if we can assist.

name: J C (WhatCanISay?!)
text: Great apartments

name: Michelle Norwood
text: Very clean complex

name: Sherry Cannon
text: I gave one star because of the horrible customer service! I've been living at the magnolia since august of 2020 and the employees at the time were great. The move in process was very easy and professional. Recently the office has hired a whole new team expect for maybe one employees (Dylan) who has been very helpful throughout this entire process. It has been very difficult to get in contact with the new property manager. It seems as if she's always unavailable, there are certain questions & concerns i have regarding my lease that only a property manager could answer. Don't get me wrong the new employees try their best to help! but i want need answers straight from the source.

resp.text: Sherry thank you for your review. After looking into this further we want to ensure that you have the correct contact information to reach our team directly. Please email info@magnoliaatauburn.com with your concerns so that we can address your situation. While we do have an entirely new team,  all of our team members are fully prepared and equipped to answer any questions. We look forward to hearing from you.  Thanks

name: A C
text: Leaving this for full transparency - many of the 5 star reviews without descriptions were essentially baited into existence. For example, residents were told there was a free Chick-fil-A breakfast, but upon arriving, were told to leave a 5 star review on Google and only then would they get it for "free". Not a good look!

resp.text: Hi A C, thank you for leaving us a review. While we like to incentivize our residents for taking the time out to leave us a review we always encourage honest feedback so that we know how we can improve. We'd love to hear from you regarding any concerns, please give us a call at 334.887.8740 and speak with our manager, Brittney. We hope to turn that 1 star into 5 stars soon!

name: sharon martin
text: The move in experience was terrible! We were told that my daughter and niece were moving into a vacant apartment and another roommate would be coming in August. We were also told the apartment would be cleaned and it was completely renovated.  Instead, someone was already in the apartment. The apartment was very dirty. And the cabinets were certainly not renovated. We were very unhappy and the office manager did nothing to correct the problem. She refused to give the deposit back or terminate the lease even though they did not provide what we were told they would. My daughter was in tears from the disappointment and I regret not reading the reviews before choosing this place. Please don't make the same mistake. While we were there I saw countless other students coming in with complaints as well.

resp.text: Hello, Sharon. Thank you for the detailed feedback regarding your recent move-in here at The Magnolia. We pride ourselves on ultimate cleanliness and apologize we have not lived up to these standards. We have taken note of your concerns and would like to further address this issue. We’d love to hear from you, please stop by the leasing office or give us a call at 334.887.8740.

name: Temple of Worship Fellowship church
text: This is an amazing place to live. There are some minor things that need to be updated but overall a great place to stay. We love to refer people to this place!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words. We appreciate you taking the time out to share your experience. We love hearing how we are doing!

name: Olivia Abrams
text: The location and price is perfect for the average college student! The staff is very helpful from receiving packages to managing maintenance issues. The amenities here are nice as well such as access to printers, personal mailboxes and good wifi. I’d definitely recommend The Magnolia Apartments to whoever is looking!

resp.text: Thank you, Olivia! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Magnolia at Auburn!

name: Nathaniel Taylor
text: Miss Averyon is one of the newest managers at the Magnolia and she  was more than helpful with everything she did. She was the most helpful on the staff and genuinely has the best intentions for the residents here at the Magnolia.

name: Travel With B
text: Moved in February, it’s been great so far. Maintenance is quick, the office staff is nice, and goes the extra mile to handle any issues that arise and the location is minutes from everything.

resp.text: Thank you, B! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Magnolia at Auburn!!

name: Cheyenne Ashou
text: The place is a great location and has a nice staff; however, there are a few things that I wish were changed. First, the apartment complex advertises itself as a gated community, but I have not seen the gates being used once overall in the 3 months I’ve lived here. Secondly, it would be nice to have access to the gym. After all if Auburn University is allowing access to the Rec Center, it only makes sense that the Magnolia would do the same as well. I understand that there is a virus in the midst, but we are all adults here and can handle ourselves. Other than that, this is a great place to live.

resp.text: Hi Cheyenne, Thank you so much for the feedback! We are in the process of having our gates repaired and hope to have them back up and running before the end of the month. We also have started our phased reopening process for the amenities and should have the gym and study lounge reopened very soon. Our clubhouse amenities are opened again now as well! We apologize for any inconvenience and again appreciate your input. Thank you! -Christina Winslett (Community Manager)

name: Camron Garner
text: What a great place to visit , I’m here with my friends all the time

resp.text: Camron, thank you for leaving this detailed feedback about your experience here at The Magnolia at Auburn. Thank you very much for sharing these comments.

resp.text: Thank you! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Magnolia at Auburn!!

resp.text: Alexandra, thank you so much for your kind words! We appreciate you taking the time to leave us a review and share your experience. We hope all of our wonderful residents, like yourself, will enjoy the many changes and improvements to come.

name: Anthony White

text: I am beyond happy that I decided to move into this community after numerous tours. Christina was extremely helpful and efficient throughout the entire process. I have to say the pool area is my absolute favorite. So well kept and gorgeous pool furniture. I would recommend any day to anyone in search of a new home!

name: ThematicJ Savy

resp.text: Colby, we love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Magnolia at Auburn!

name: Makayla Thibodeaux
text: Meet Andrew and Averyon today. Very nice and welcoming. The magnolia has a very nice gym and workout space. definitely look forward to visiting more often

resp.text: Makayla, thank you for your feedback!

name: Travtya Banks
text: Awesome place! I believe a young blonde man and a girl name Maggy helped my grandson find comfort in his new home. Everything on college is very close to him and he still was able to succeed in school, even from off campus.

text: Great place havent had any problems in the 3years ive been here!

name: Asri Juniati
text: Cozy apartment, friendly management teams. I love the Magnolia because I always get what I want from the team. It’s only 10 minutes from campus . They often provide us with free breakfast and stuff even in corona time.

resp.text: Asri, thank you for your feedback! We love that you enjoy living at The Magnolia at Auburn!

name: Caroline C
text:
An overall good experience, but for the price, it's a great deal!

Pros: super spacious living room, generally quick responses for maintenance requests, property grounds are kept up nicely, walls are nowhere near as thin as other places I've lived

Cons: very slow internet -- I'm a student and when using Zoom, I can only get audio but it's not enough to stream the video content too--there was a pretty bad pest issue when I first moved in but they were quick to spray when I let them know, moldy air vents / cabinets

resp.text: Caroline, thank you for the detailed feedback regarding your experience at The Magnolia at Auburn! We pride ourselves on providing the best possible experience. Please continue to reach out to us if you have any further issues!

name: Kathryn Sweeden
text: Good place to live! I love the 3 bedroom 3 bathroom accommodations & the people in the front office have been doing their best with the COVID situation! Nice gym & pool.

resp.text: Kathryn, thank you for leaving a review! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us!

name: Gregory Walker
text: Fairly great place. Wish the gym were open and the gates would work but its been pleasant nonetheless. Maintenance always comes and resolves issues fairly quickly and the location is fantastic with two tiger transit stops. Definitely worth the price.

resp.text: Hi Gregory, thank you for your feedback! We are in the process of repairing the gates and hope to have them back up and running as soon as possible. We are also currently reopening our amenities on a phased schedule. Our clubhouse is now back open and the gym and pool should follow shortly. We apologize for this inconvenience. Please let us know if there is anything else we can do to assist you. Thank you! -Christina Winslett (Community Manager)

name: Madelyn Seaman
text: I just moved here this fall and I’ve had nothing but good experiences. The staff is very friendly and very interactive with their events. The Magnolia is in a very convenient place in town, being across from a Walmart and close to some very good restaurants. Overall I’ve really like living here and I highly recommend The Magnolia to anyone searching for an apartment.

resp.text: Madelyn, thank you so much for the feedback and review! We love hearing our residents have had great experiences here at The Magnolia.

resp.text: Erryial, thank you for leaving your review! We appreciate your feedback and are always looking for way to improve!

name: Andrew Roth
text: I’ve loved living here through the past four years! Things have changed for the better in so many ways! I love the community, and the fact we are pet friendly! Hopefully there will be some more community event soon, they are always fun!

resp.text: Thank you, Andrew! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Magnolia at Auburn!!

name: Khadijah Graves
text: There is mold throughout my entire room. When you come inside, you can smell the mold. I made a request to get it fixed and it took maintenance 3 weeks to get to my apartment after multiple reminders. Once maintenance came, they only focused on my bathroom. They tore the wall down and placed  a dehumidifier in my room for about a week. They place me in what looks like an  abandoned apartment for the time being. Literally, nothing worked in the temporary apartment. Once they fixed the wall, they never came back to repaint it. I have reminded them over and over and its been 3 month and no one has showed up to finish the job. Now there is mold growing again! This is disgusting and no one should have to live in these conditions. DO NOT MOVE HERE! It's not worth it.

resp.text:
Hello Khadijah,

We are sorry to hear about the issues in your apartment. Our management and maintenance teams work together to ensure our residents enjoy a comfortable community, so we regret that this matter has not been completely addressed to your satisfaction. Our team wants to resolve this for you and did go to your apartment to begin the repairs yesterday.  The Community Manager will follow up with you once the repairs are completed to ensure you are satisfied with the results.  In the meantime, please do not hesitate to reach out to the Community Manager at  SocialMgr@WaypointStudentLiving.com if you need to share additional information.
Thank you.

name: Sylvia Masango
text: I lived at The Magnolia at Auburn Apartments for almost four years and thoroughly enjoyed my experience. The latest renovations provide great updated amenities and the apartment complex also hosts engaging events (prior to COVID). The location is also prime for the average college student. The staff are friendly and professional and will go out of their way to ensure their residents are taken care of. I'd like to give a special shoutout to Ms. Averyon, who just recently started working there. She will go above and beyond to make sure all your residential needs are taken care of and is incredibly kind and thoughtful.

resp.text: Thank you, Sylvia! We love hearing that you enjoyed living with us.

name: Ashley Glaze
text: I am super excited to live here next year! The girl that showed me around was great and super helpful answering my questions. The apartments are nice and the gym is huge!

resp.text: We cannot wait to have you as a resident, Ashley! We know you will love the community as well as the amenities! Keep an eye out this summer when we start hosting invents for our new incoming residents! Thanks so much for the review.

name: PoppinWithJo
text: Would only consider living here if you absolutely have no where else to live! The location is great! But that’s the only positive about this place. Maintenance doesn’t fulfill your requests in a timely manner and if they do, it’s never fully completed just covered up to where you’ll have to call and ask to have the same task completed again. They never notify you when they’ve been in your house, and they steal! They’ve stolen money straight out of my drawer before. If you happen to have issues with your roommate they DO NOT care, nor do they try to resolve the issue. They ignore your calls and emails and never actually resolve anything. When they do respond they say they’ll do things they never do! All apartments are INFESTED with gnats to the point where they end up in your refrigerator. Pest control may come, but never resolves the issue. Sometimes pest control says they’ve came and they actually never come so you’re left waking up with gnats in your bed! Renovated apartments look nice until you move in and find a ton of things need to be done. Gym sucks, pools are about the only great amenity. So please think again and again and again before deciding to move into this  place, unless sleeping with gnats and bed bugs doesn’t bother you and you don’t mind issues not being resolved. I would never suggest anyone move here!

resp.text: Ms. Mitchell, we are sorry to hear you had this experience. To our knoweldge, the office was not made aware of these issues and would love to discuss them futher to come to a solution. Please feel free to contact us, we would be happy to help in anyway we can. Thank you, Christina Winslett (Community Manager)

name: Jemma Constant
text: Do not waste your money here. The wifi constantly cuts out throughout the entire complex, and I have spoken to the staff multiple times about fixing it, and each time they act like it is the first time hearing about the issue. After speaking with Comcast, they said that the entire wifi system is very old and outdated, and needs to be completely replaced or the shortages will continue to happen. I will not be renewing my lease here and would not recommend this place to anyone. There is a huge lack of communication among staff, and nothing ever gets fixed. Also, the only reason why they have some good reviews is because they offer prizes to anyone who writes a good review, to try and even out all the terrible, truthful reviews.

resp.text: Jemma, thank you for your detailed review! We sincerely appreciate your feedback. Please contact the leasing office at 334.887.8740 to discuss these concerns further!

name: Caroline MacCaughelty
text: I would give 0 stars if I could. I was asked to take down this review by the property manager here at The Magnolia because she didn't want anyone to know what I really thought of this place and its management. Well, I'm putting my review back up and this time it's staying. The Magnolia has some of the worst management I have ever come in contact with. The managers are rude and dismissive of issues that I've had. They have allowed their vendors to enter my room without my knowledge, violating my privacy and then treating the issue like a small minor problem. Maintenance is stoned whenever they come to fix things, never in a timely manner, and the manager denies this fact. In the end, it doesn't matter if you fixed it or not, the process was arduous and awful for me. They were rude almost the ENTIRE time and did not treat me like a customer who is paying their salary. They in NO WAY went above and beyond to assist me. They did the BARE MINIMUM. I have many more complaints that I've already sent to corporate that contain way too much for one google review. To summarize, save your money. Magnolia IS NOT worth it.

resp.text: Ms. MacCaughelty, I asked you to please consider removing your original review because you posted it before allowing us an opportunity to fix the items in your apartment, all of which have since been fixed. Your claims against our team members are unfounded and slanderous. Our team has gone above and beyond to address every concern and service request in your apartment. However, regardless of which team member responds or interacts with you, you feel the need to belittle them and accuse them of false actions. Our team is committed to providing excellent customer service and assisting our residents in any way possible and we know we will continue to show you that through the duration of your lease. Thank you, Christina Winslett (Community Manager)

name: Clara Hanbyeol Jin
text: I usually don't write reviews but I am fed up dealing with this apartment. I have renewed multiple times due to the proximity to my workplace and the relatively low rent but working with management has been a nightmare. I have called and visited the front desk FREQUENTLY to try to get a hold of the manager but she is always conveniently "in a meeting." I believe the front desk student assistants do their portion of the job taking down my name, unit & phone # to have her call me back but I have NEVER gotten a call back. It has taken my roommate and I 2.5 YEARS of harassing the front desk student workers only to get a flooring issue "semi" resolved by the management. OCCASIONAL email replies as a result of the harassment is the only form of communication we have been receiving. I am also expecting TWO concession payments: one of which clearly states that it would be given out within 30 days (it has been almost two months now) of the lease renewal date and another for referring a friend. This latter one does not even have a contract or a form of agreement, so the only argument I have in favor of my case, is a screenshot of the advertisement from two months ago. When inquired about this issue, the office only came back to me and said that I would hear from corporate soon and took no action whatsoever to accelerate this process. The only positive side of this complex is that the in-house maintenance is usually quick to respond (and the high water pressure is a bonus). There have been more than enough hiccups with our air conditioning which eventually got switched out to a new one (most of the A/C units are probably in need of an upgrade due to age). Gates have been installed as a "solution" for all the shootings that have happened recently, but have not been activated as they are still waiting to pass out parking passes/gate access as we approach the THIRD month of the lease term. There have been three changes in management companies in less than three years, which should explain the mess that this apartment is in, but I believe the actual on-site manager, Christina, who has stayed at the site despite the changes, is a main source of all these negative reviews from current residents. If "short-staffing" is the issue here, please hire someone else to help her address these matters - this apartment is not maintained well enough to justify the rent and the lack of response that the residents are receiving.

resp.text: Clara, thank you for sharing this experience with us. We're pleased to know that you've enjoyed speedy service from our maintenance team and value our high water pressure! However, we are concerned with the lack of responsiveness you've received from management and can understand how that would be a source of frustration. We will call you soon to touch base and assess how we can best assist you, but please also feel free to reach out to us anytime at SocialMgr@WaypointStudentLiving.com. Thanks so much for your review and bringing this matter to our attention.

name: Kevin Pham
text: A great place to live!

resp.text: Thank you, Kevin! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Magnolia at Auburn!!

name: Jessica Staggs
text: When signing the lease, there was an issue with the signatures and no one there knew how to fix it; we had to redo the entire lease three times. Apartments have water damage just covered up in paint, luckily there have been no further leaks. Upon move-in, I was given the wrong mailbox and front door key. Other than poor management, the complex is clean and feels safe. Looking forward to the new managers under the Magnolia, so far they've been way better.

resp.text: Jessica, thank you for reviewing and sharing what peace of mind you've felt in our community. We want your entire experience to be great, so we're sorry to hear you've had concerns with our service to your home and upon move-in. We'd like to check in to ensure any unresolved concerns are addressed promptly, so a member of our team will call you soon. We also welcome your input at SocialMgr@WaypointStudentLiving.com anytime. We look forward to connecting with you.

name: 缪承赟
text: I really wish I could give 0 star here. The management is chaotic, and irresponsible. They even bully the residents by ignoring some facts which are beneficial to the residents, but not to them.

resp.text: Thank you for your honest feedback. We strive for the best customer service and apologize we did not meet the expectation. We’d love to make this up to you and discuss your concerns in person to assure they are taken care of correctly. Please contact us at info@MagnoliaAtAuburn.com or 334-887-8740 and ask to speak with me directly. Thank you, Christina (Community Manager)

name: Tianna Surls
text: Good apartment for students

resp.text: Tianna, thank you for your review!

name: Kalen Rhodes
text: This place is awesome!!

resp.text: Kalen, thank you for leaving this feedback about your experience with The Magnolia at Auburn!

name: Hunter Taylor
text: The social is a great place for incoming freshman. Not only is the rent super affordable, the apartments are spacious and nice. The management team is so helpful. Johnathan Mitchell helped me handle a lot of information that I wasn't understanding and was so nice. It really spoke a lot about the management office and their willingness and strive to help all of their tenants.

resp.text: Thank you,Hunter! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Social Auburn!! We'll make sure to let Johnathan know of all the great things you have said about him!

name: Joshua Williams
text: Great place to stay

resp.text: Joshua, thank you for your review!

name: M H
text:
I have enjoyed my time living at The Social and plan to renew my lease for this upcoming year. I wouldn't say my experience has been perfect, but you get what you pay for. As The Social is one of the most affordable apartment complexes in Auburn, you shouldn't come here with overly high  expectations. For the price you pay, this is a great complex. They are not as renovated as I had hoped, but the appliances are in good working order, which is all that matters to me. Management has worked with my roommates and I each time we have had an issue. Recently, they credited our accounts after a broken AC unit ran up the power bill. Next week they will be replacing the unit. Maintenance can be slow to respond at times, but this typically coincides with times when many people are putting in requests, such as on move-in day. The staff at The Social are always helpful and have resolved each issue I have presented them with. I would say overall that The Social is a great place to live and I would recommend it to others.

Update: Since my original review, all of my kitchen appliances have been replaced. The kitchen was completely redone and I was told I should be getting new furniture in the near future. A new management team has taken over and made vast improvements to the property and to many, if not all, of the units. Currently they are resurfacing the front pool and soon they will be putting a dog park in the back of the complex. I am still very satisfied with my living experience at The Social and I still recommend it, especially now!

resp.text: Thank you, MK! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Social Auburn!! If you ever have any issues during your stay, please reach out to us and let us know!

name: Samantha Adams
text: The Social is a pretty nice place to live. The office staff is super nice and try to help you however they can. They recently changed management companies and there have been a lot of improvements since. The apartments are already upgraded, but they've recently been remodeling all of the kitchens and they look amazing. The prices are good and relatively cheap, and you get what you pay for. I would definitely recommend living here.

resp.text: Thank you, Samantha! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Social Auburn!! Let us know if you need anything during your stay.

name: Tianna Surls
text: Good apartment for students

resp.text: Tianna, thank you for your review!

name: a A
text: This complex is a joke. I’ve lived here twice and had 2 leases and I regret it. The first time, they charged me for rent that I did not owe after I went to the office multiple times to clear this up. This second time, there was a shooting outside my building and the power hungry management team  responded by implementing very strict parking rules that are not needed. The complex never issued us guest parking passes in the first place. They complain about non residents parking in guest spaces when they never gave their residents guest parking passes which would have cleared that problem to begin with. Most apartment complexes issue their residents one parking pass and a guest pass but not the social! It doesn’t matter if your friends or family come to visit and they leave their car for 49 hours, they will tow it. They obviously had massive resident backlash from this policy otherwise they wouldn’t have sent out an email basically giving their own residents the finger. last time I checked, Adults live here not children so management should stop treating us like children. Trust me. There are better apartment complexes in Auburn.

resp.text: Andrew, we regret to hear of your disappointment as our resident. It is our mission to provide you with an excellent home, and we're sorry if you've been displeased with our management and parking policies. Thank you for allowing our Manager the chance to connect with you directly this week, as we appreciate the opportunity to better understand your experience and address your concerns. And don't hesitate to reach out directly in the future, at SocialMgr@WaypointStudentLiving.com, if we can be of assistance in any way. We appreciate your residency.

name: Woo Pettway
text: Love it here !! Renewing my lease tomorrow !!!!

resp.text: Thank you, Woo! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Magnolia at Auburn!!

name: Tre'nae Emerson
text: The community is always clean, the staff is friendly and dedicated to helping with whatever I may need. The rules are fairly reasonable and the cost of living is GREAT!!

resp.text: Awesome, Tre'nae! We're happy to know you find our community such a great value and that you've had great service from our staff. Thank you for sharing!

name: Radini Dissanayaka
text: I recently moved into Social and I really really love it. The staff is super nice. I first signed the lease in March but I had to cancel it bcz of some problems with my sublease of my previous apartment. Social management were super cool about it and canceled my lease without asking any questions which I really appreciate. Then I again signed my lease after a month. There are no deposit whatsoever when you move in. You only have to pay the monthly rent (when move in) which is great. It is one of the most affordable apartment complexes in Auburn and the apartment you get for your price is worth it. Plus if you sign your lease during their promotional time period you might get lucky and get a gift card :) The apartment was well cleaned when I moved in. They recently replaced all the Kitchen appliances and the Kitchen  was completely redone. Now my apartment looks even better. I have had bad experiences with some other property managements but my experience with Social so far is nothing but best. I highly recommend this place.

resp.text: Thank you, Radini! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Social Auburn!! If you need anything in the near future, please stop by the office and we will be glad to help.

name: Devin Jiles
text: The Social is a great place to stay. Walmart is walking distance along with Burger King and Wendy’s. Beds are furnished and are as comfortable as It gets. Bathrooms are in the rooms and are decent sized. Very quiet and great views outside. Good places around the complex for reading or doing homework outdoors.

resp.text: Thank you, Devin! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Social Auburn!!

name: Jackie Buck
text: Leasing here was very simple and the staff was really knowledgeable and friendly. I'm excited to spend my last year of college living here and take advantage of the renovations in the gym and study room!

resp.text: Hi Jackie! We are so happy you chose to call The Magnolia home this fall. Glad you get to take advantage of our new gym & study rooms!! Feel free to reach out if you ever need anything!! -Levi (Community Manager)

name: aisha favors
text: The amenities are very beautiful, and the renovated apartments are very nice. There is a good amount of space for the bedrooms, and the living room/kitchen area.

resp.text: Thank you, Aisha. We love taking care of our beautiful community, and we're glad you approve!

name: Devin Jiles
text: The Social is a great place to stay. Walmart is walking distance along with Burger King and Wendy’s. Beds are furnished and are as comfortable as It gets. Bathrooms are in the rooms and are decent sized. Very quiet and great views outside. Good places around the complex for reading or doing homework outdoors.

resp.text: Thank you, Devin! We love hearing that you enjoy living with us, and we love that you are here at The Social Auburn!!

name: Madison Woodard
text: I absolutely love dealing with the management, so friendly and welcoming!
