I live in a four room apartment here, and I haven't seen any other apartment complex around top the ones here at the Connection!

name: Alura Neville
text: I love the Connection at Auburn! We have a great staff and awesome events. We cater to our residents and want to make sure they have the best living experience!

name: Nyra' Alcorn
text: I love the connections at Auburn. They matched me perfectly with great room mates that I will be able to call life long friends. The apartments and amenities are great as well

name: Liam Wood
text: Upon moving out and handing them my keys, I received a notice from the connection stating that I did not return my keys and was fined around $500 to be collected by a collections agency and took a hit to my credit score. I strongly recommend getting everything in writing, and a receipt for everything here.

resp.text: Liam, thank you for expressing your concerns. We are sorry to hear that you had a bad experience. We do allow a time frame for residents to express their concerns in regards to any charges. Please contact our office if you would like to discuss your concerns any further.

name: Rizwan Ibrahim
text: Living at the Connection in Auburn is great! It is a great place to live and is a great value. I have never heard horror stories from people from the connection unlike other apartments.

name: Gabi Marie
text:
I've lived here for 3 years and it's horrible. Let me just tell you SOME of my experiences over the years.
1. The apartments aren't really that clean when you move in, you can still have someone's stuff still in drawers and things like that.
2. You're suppose to get a notice that people are coming into your apartment. There have been MULTIPLE instances people just show up, luckily I was home. However! One time I didn't hear the door and they just walked right in. They never sent any type of email they were coming or put anything on the door.
3. Maintenance is slow and important. I promise you SOMETHING is going to break in your apartment. It's all cheap. My dryer, dish washer, AC, toilet has all broken and for all of them it took us having to bug them for them to even come up in a timely manner... ESPECIALLY for the AC that broke in the middle of the summer.
4. Black "stuff" grows in all of the bathroom drains. They claim it's just "dirty" but I've never seen this black stuff ever in my life. Just here at the connection.
5. The office staff can be friendly depending who you talk to, but management is truly useless.
6. They will find anything and everything to charge you for. They're definitely here to take your money.
7. When I moved in I was told every year you stay and resign your lease rent will go down. That's what kept me here for 3 years. However I'm now moving out because they started raising prices and I promise.. ITS NOT WORTH IT!
8. The "security guard" they have here is rude. I asked him a simple question about when the club house closed and he gave me a very rude response and laughed at me.
9. The hot tub has been broken forever. It's not even clean. It's truly disgusting.  Half the equipment in the gym is broken. Last time I went to the computer lab, more than half the computers didn't work and the printer didn't work either. The pool table and ping pong table are both broken in the club house, make sure not to lean on them. Almost all the chairs at the pools are broken and the ones that you're suppose to be able to sit in in the water are never cleaned so they have definitely grown some bacteria.
10. The front gate is always broken. If you're looking for a safe place with a gate and security, this isn't the place. Anyone can come in or out.

name: Cassidee Jones
text: Great place to live. Transit can take anywhere between 10-15 minutes to get to campus. It's a little far away from everything. Perfect size. Sometimes the appliances struggle but the oddest ways of fixing them work best. Lots of cabinet space and storage space in all rooms and kicthen.

name: Sam Bartlett
text: Hasty maintenance, pleasant desk staff, and fantastic amenities complement the spacious rooms at the Connection. The single downside is the parking availability. The high priced covered spaces take up half the parking and are only 1/5 occupied. If the price was knocked down to about half it's current rate, buying a covered space would be reasonable. This creates an issue where spaces anywhere near your apartment may be all occupied and your vehicle must be parked relatively far away.  The Connection also advertises as supplying HBO - but that is not currently available.

name: Amanda Youngpeter
text: The first year I lived here was fine, even though my apartment was given to me with soiled carpets, bent up blinds, no peep hole in front door and a flea investation. The maintenance worked pretty quickly. However they did end up charging my roommate for a dirty oven which they cleaned, a whole new counter top because of some chips on the side that were already there and a new laundry door because of the roller on top wouldn't stay in place, though I ended up fixing it myself because they seemed like they didn't want to bother with it. The second year went a whole lot worse. They tried to evict me due to miscommunication between there departments and their back gate has been somewhat down for a over a month now.(you can go out, but the clicker doesn't work so you can't come back in or out if you wanted to go on a walk) Also, I wouldn't trust roommate matching too much. The roommate they gave me for my second year told me her dog wasn't a yapper, however that dog seemed like it yapped nonstop. She also didn't take care of him very well. She wouldn't take him out before she left in the morning and when she left she was gone for majority of the day, so he would end up going to the bathroom in the apartment. I ended up taking care of him so much that it felt like he had became my dog and I don't do small dogs. The only good thing that came out of it was that the apartment itself was nice after it had been cleaned up, the bathtub was a very nice plus, and I basically had a pool view without paying the pool view price. It is also very convenient to interstate when the gate is working, location is fantastic. It's a great place to live if you have the patience to put up with management and going over those dang speed bumps. Wish I could stay where I'm at, but I don't have the mind nor the patience to deal with management.

name: Jared Sweat
text: The front desk is super helpful and is always nice to me whenever I have questions. Wifi could be a little better though!

resp.text:
Jared,

Thank you for the review, we are glad your experience here has been enjoyable!

name: Rizwan Ibrahim
text: Living at the Connection in Auburn is great! It is a great place to live and is a great value. I have never heard horror stories from people from the connection unlike other apartments.

name: Tamara Wyckoff
text: When I went on the tour of the Connection at Auburn I was very pleased and satisfied with my choice to move in! I move in this weekend and I cannot wait. I love everything about this place!

name: Nyra' Alcorn
text: I love the connections at Auburn. They matched me perfectly with great room mates that I will be able to call life long friends. The apartments and amenities are great as well

name: Gabriela Rodriguez
text: This place has the absolute worst management. Let's start with how they surprised me with a rent raise due to renovations AFTER I had already renewed my lease! So, basically I had to submit and pay more per month or be forced to move out. Then, they told us renovations would start May 23-24. Yea the floors got done on time, but they also tore down my curtains and completely took my bed apart without putting any of it back. Then, they never came back to finish the apartment. Every week we called and were met with the same response: "we'll send out a schedule next week." Turns out next week means the day before they claim renovations will finish. Except it didn't. Keep in mind, all of our kitchen items and drawers have to be removed for them to change the countertops. Imagine my surprise when I come home the following day after working my Saturday morning shift to find these people working in my apartment. This was almost TWO months after it was supposed to be finished. I had received no notification that they were going to be working in my apartment on the weekend. This is certainly not the only major problem I've had with management AND maintenance here. Unless you're okay with living with instability and bending to the will of others, don't waste your time or money here. The only good thing about this place is that it is close to Walmart.

name: Jentry Chesnut
text: Great place to live for a very fair price. With all the amenities and furnished apartments, it's definitely worth it. I'm glad I choose to live here at the Connection!

name: Ian Fraser
text:
TL;DR of previous review: communication with residents is poor.

EDIT: over my final year the general communication from the Connection improved somewhat and front office staff were much more responsive. Thus I've bumped up a couple stars.

The lack of stars is mostly due to the internet situation at this point. I spent 5+ hours spring semester on the phone with Single Digits, even had them bring out a tech to try and fix connectivity issues. They would blame The Connection, I'd talk to the front office and they'd blame Single Digits. At some point I don't care who's at fault I just want my internet connectivity to work consistently.

name: Amanda Youngpeter
text: The first year I lived here was fine, even though my apartment was given to me with soiled carpets, bent up blinds, no peep hole in front door and a flea investation. The maintenance worked pretty quickly. However they did end up charging my roommate for a dirty oven which they cleaned, a whole new counter top because of some chips on the side that were already there and a new laundry door because of the roller on top wouldn't stay in place, though I ended up fixing it myself because they seemed like they didn't want to bother with it. The second year went a whole lot worse. They tried to evict me due to miscommunication between there departments and their back gate has been somewhat down for a over a month now.(you can go out, but the clicker doesn't work so you can't come back in or out if you wanted to go on a walk) Also, I wouldn't trust roommate matching too much. The roommate they gave me for my second year told me her dog wasn't a yapper, however that dog seemed like it yapped nonstop. She also didn't take care of him very well. She wouldn't take him out before she left in the morning and when she left she was gone for majority of the day, so he would end up going to the bathroom in the apartment. I ended up taking care of him so much that it felt like he had became my dog and I don't do small dogs. The only good thing that came out of it was that the apartment itself was nice after it had been cleaned up, the bathtub was a very nice plus, and I basically had a pool view without paying the pool view price. It is also very convenient to interstate when the gate is working, location is fantastic. It's a great place to live if you have the patience to put up with management and going over those dang speed bumps. Wish I could stay where I'm at, but I don't have the mind nor the patience to deal with management.

name: Sydney Slaughter
text: As far as location, this complex is great. The transit ride alone is very convenient. Maintenance was always helpful and came quickly. The problems I have are with the room size, being that they are rather small and management. Upon moving out, I was charged for the replacement of my bedroom carpet and not returning a key (it was returned, but the workers in the office didn't file paperwork properly.) I had an area rug that covered my entire bedroom floor, yet management is claiming there are stains (NOT rips or tears, simply foot traffic from outside) bad enough to need a whole new carpet replacement. I emailed my concerns to management and they replied a week later saying the $225 is due in 2 days. I think The Connection is looking for any and every way to get your money. Be wary and GET EVERYTHING IN WRITING.

resp.text: We regret that you have had an unpleasant experience. Resident satisfaction is extremely important to us. Please give us the opportunity to change your opinion. We can be reached at 334.821.3301 & community email at connectionauburn@achliving.com. The management office is open M-F 10-5. We look forward to improving your opinion!

name: Jared Sweat
text: The front desk is super helpful and is always nice to me whenever I have questions. Wifi could be a little better though!

resp.text:
Jared,

Thank you for the review, we are glad your experience here has been enjoyable!

name: Joan Velasquez
text:
This is my first and only review I have ever made, but The Connection drove me to this. The Connection is easily the worst place I have lived in, I cannot stress this enough. Take your money somewhere else and save yourself many headaches and stress. If you don’t have the time to read my whole review with all the details, then just take a look at all the other reviews to get an idea of the quality of this place. And don’t be fooled by the 5 star reviews you see in the last year, because the connection offered the residents $100 dollars in exchange for a positive review. This is how desperate they are to make themselves look good. It should also give you an idea of how duplicitous their style of management truly is. They invest money, time, and effort into putting up a front and tricking people to sign-in instead of using that time to actually do their work properly and fix their current problems.
I lived with them for 2.5 years. My first year with them was ok, and I had no issues. However, everything started to go wrong when the new manager, Matthew, came in. This is why you should avoid this place at all costs:
1) Incorrect Late Fees and payment problems:
All apartment complexes have a resident portal where you can pay your rent online. These portals also allow you to save payment methods so that you don’t have to re-enter your payment information every month. I made my payments with the checking account of my bank (NOT my debit/credit card, because I don’t have to worry about changing the payment information if it ever got lost or stolen). When you make a payment, you receive a message and an email telling you that the payment went through. One day during my last semester with them, I received an email informing me of the following: My payments for the last two months had been rejected, that I had over $300 dollars in late fees, that they tried to reach me by calling me and by going to my apartment, and that if I did not made the full payment of that last two months plus late fees and charge back fees in the next 3 days, I would be evicted! I had no records in my phone of any calls being made to me from them, and I’m never at my apartment during business hours because I’m in the Auburn campus. But they could not be bothered to email me about this until 3 days before I would get evicted! They waited more than 70 days to send me a freaking email, and gave me less than a week to pay them. I immediately told them that I will pay the two months of rent but that I will not pay any extra charges or fees. I proved to them that I received a confirmation email from them for both payments. Apparently, that email was worthless, because that email only means that your payment request went through, not that the bank transferred the money. They told me that I must have made a mistake when filling out my payment information. I proved to them that this is impossible because  I used my saved Checking account to pay, the same account that I have used for the last 2 years without any issues. Then, they told me that the payments did not go through because I did not have enough money in the bank at the time of the payments! So now I had to give them proof of my bank records of the last two months to show them that at the time of the payment, I had more than enough money in my account. I felt like I was had to be a lawyer to not get overcharged by these people. But what really made me mad is that after all this proof, they still had to “talk” to their upper management to check on this. They proceeded to tell me that they wanted a freaking bank representative to basically prove to them that the bank did not make a mistake. Ridiculous! They could not admit that their online portal had a glitch or messed up. I had to invest too much time and effort in order to not get screwed over.
There is not enough space for me to write everything I want. So here are the highlights:
2) Incorrect parking charges 3) Inorrect Fees After Moving Out 4) Rent Kept Rising 5) Horrible communication with management 6) Bad Maitenance 7) you can hear everything

resp.text:
Hello Joan,

We are sorry to hear about your frustrations with our property. A manager will be reaching out to you soon to discuss the issues mentioned above. Thank you!

name: Walt Williams
text: Expect to be nickel and dimed for everything. They lost several of my packages. Every interaction with the office feels like a nightmare of paperwork. The apartments themselves are pretty nice though.

name: Kay Lyn
text: I've enjoyed living here. The only complaint I have is that there is a muddy walk to the transit stop and no where to stand in the rain while waiting for the transit. I really like the activities and I love that there is a dog park on the complex.

name: Andrew “Chase” R
text:
Updated review after 3 years:
Rent has increased to the point where The Connection is no longer a good deal for anyone on a budget.

The renovated floors leave gaps over an inch wide between the floors and doors, so you can hear EVERYTHING in the common area and anything louder than normal conversation volume from your roommates' rooms.

The new renovations as a whole are a bunch of gimmicks no one asked for so management could justify charging an extra $600 per year. The floors were installed looking scuffed and the countertops are great at hiding spills and messes so be sure to clean often. The 40" smart TV is nice if your roommates don't mind the noise, and the extra deep sinks are fantastic for hand washing dishes better than the dishwasher ever will.

Management doesn't communicate with the residents well, when they bother communicating at all. Even the people at the office are left out of the loop so you can hardly ever get straight answers from them, though they are always nice and never at fault themselves.

They cut bike locks and took all bikes off the property on short notice, while students were away on break, and have not been able to provide an adequate place for locking up bikes despite initially repeating promises of new equipment "next week" or "in a few days."

Maintenance has always been wonderful for me. They're always busy so you should expect to wait one or two business days, but I've never had to wait longer than two for any issue big or small.

The back gate is always padlocked and the front gate is always broken and left open. Don't let them fool you into thinking they finally fixed it, it will likely fail again after a few days and is a lost cause.

Junk mail is a huge problem. There are literal buckets of overflowing junk mail at every set of mail boxes.

The internet provider, Airwaves, was bought out by Single Digits and the connection on our (recently upgraded) networks have become unreliable. The connection became slow and intermittent overnight. Basic security procedures are not provided for guests and the connection is even worse if you don't register your MAC addresses online, which can be a glitchy process requiring a call to tech support.

I will no longer be recommending The Connection to others.

Original review w/ 5 stars c. 2016:
The rent isn't bad for what you get. My apartment is clean and hasn't had any issues. Management can be tough to deal with, but it's even worse at most other places. The key is to go to the office yourself and speak with someone in person, and keep coming back. I had trouble even signing my lease; errors with the website and repeated phone calls with different staff. But on my first visit about the issue everything was sorted out and on the second I had my lease signed.

resp.text:
Good Afternoon Chase,

Thank you for the review, I will try to address your concerns in the order mentioned!

For most properties, rent will change from year to year. To keep up with the ever-evolving market, we decided to renovate last year. These renovations included installing hardwood flooring throughout the entire unit, replacing the previous countertops with granite in both the kitchen and bathrooms, putting in new sink fixtures in the kitchen and bathrooms, and setting up a 55" tv in the common area of each renovated unit. While not everyone will appreciate these renovations equally, the majority will agree that they are both aesthetically pleasing and more practical.

As a management team, we do our best to make sure residents share the same knowledge that we do, whether it be through signage posted throughout the property, emails, etc. For the majority of updates, we will send an email to residents. To ensure you are receiving these emails, please make sure you are opted in to email updates in your resident portal. If you need any help changing this setting, please let us know!

Storing bikes in the breezeway of the buildings is not only unsightly, but also a fire hazard. Resident safety is of great importance to us. With this in mind, we required residents to either remove their bikes from the breezeway or we removed them. However, upon removal, we stored the bikes for about two months and gave residents the option to have them returned for free.

We are glad to hear that your experience with maintenance has been so wonderful! While each issue varies, it is nice to hear that maintenance has always responded in a timely manner.

You are correct that the back gate was locked for a short time period around the summer. At the time, our gate contractor was unable to get to the property immediately and we made the decision to lock the back gate with resident safety in mind. Otherwise, the gate was able to be opened with or without an access device. With all technology, there are issues that inevitably occur. We have actually recently spoken with our gate contractor and they will be here by the end of the week to take a look at the gate. We will work with them to make sure this is not a routine occurrence!

We completely understand your frustration with junk mail. Unfortunately, with the amount of companies who advertise through mail, there is not much we can do on our end. To encourage residents not to litter any junk mail, we set up bins by each mailbox area for disposal of junk mail.

For any internet issues, Single Digits has asked that we advise residents to reach out to them by phone at (877) 778-9283. The internet service being provided is the same that was provided by Airwaves. However, we have reached out to Single Digits to see if there is anything we can do on our end to help and are waiting to hear back.

We sincerely appreciate everything you mentioned in your review and hope that we helped clarify some of your concerns. If you have any future recommendations or concerns, please do not hesitate to reach out to us at (334) 821-3301 or info@connectionauburn.com. We are always open to resident feedback!

name: jacob korshak
text: Have tried multiple times to fix WiFi and internet and neither single digits or connection is helpful at all. Both say it's the others fault or something like that.

resp.text:
Jacob,

Thank you for the review. If there is anything we can do to improve your experience here, please email info@connectionauburn.com and we would be happy to help!

name: sherry Newton
text: Very poor management.  My daughter and her 3 roommates, who are all transfer students, were told in February they had a 4 bedroom apt available and signed a lease.   The end of March we were told an apt was not available and the girls would be dispersed to different apts.  along witn 41 other students.  Very poor management!!!!

name: Lydia Smith
text: This is the worst place ever. I lived here last year and did not have any problems, but this year has been a bust. I have not gotten the incentive that I was promised last year for renewing my lease for 2018-2019. The internet is a piece of garbage. The internet will cut off or I just can't use it to get on netflix for my t.v. because the internet is not good enough. My water is awful. When take a shower, four minutes into it the water turns cold. The carpet was nasty when I moved in, and they said they were going to come clean it and never did. I would honestly give them negative stars if google allowed it.

resp.text:
Good Afternoon Stuart,

We are sorry to hear of your frustrations. All incentives were sent out last Spring. If you did not receive yours, please contact the office and we would be happy to get it to you! All internet-related issues must be directed to Single Digits at (877) 778-9283. If there is anything else we can do to assist you, do not hesitate to contact the office at info@connectionauburn.com!

name: Lillian Jackson
text: I recommend The Connection for college students. Everything is kept clean and the staff is very nice.

name: BinaryCavemen
text: Absolutely horrible management that is not communicative. The internet is horrible and nothing has been done to fix. During peak hours even opening a web browser is difficult.

resp.text: We are sorry to hear of your negative experience. As a whole, the staff tries to be as responsive and helpful as possible. If you have any specific concerns we can address, please email info@connectionauburn.com!

name: Scott Barton
text: This is my third year renting from this apartment complex. It was all fine until this year. The management does NOT care about fixing things, or the inconvenience it causes you. I WOULD RENT SOMEWHERE ELSE.

name: Jessica Ramos
text: I have not yet moved in however ive ran into an issue that I have been trying to get settled since May it is now almost the end of July and I am still getting the run around. Please please make sure that any communication with management you get in writing!! especially if they tell you that move in can be done earlier due to specific circumstances!.... I would also like to add that half of my review was deleted on their Facebook page by their staff, it said not different than my review here.

resp.text: We're sorry you're having a negative experience as customer service is important to us. We would like to hear your concerns and assist you. Please contact the management office directly so that we can rectify your issues. We are available M-F 10-6, at 334.821.3301 or email us at connectionauburn@achliving.com

name: Lydia Ray
text: Even though the apartments are considerably nice, they're not nice enough to make up for the cost of rent. With mold on the walls, rust in the sink, thin walls, and stains in the carpet, I would not consider this a luxury apartment.  You can't even call it a gated complex. The gate is either always open or it won't even let you in at all. On top of that, the Connection management does not follow the proper rules and regulations. Originally I thought I had only signed for a sublease of six months until six months later when I thought I would be moving out, I was informed I actually automatically signed for a whole new year when I had signed for the first lease. Signing two leases at once is illegal. And then after turning down the first two people who wanted to sublease for me, they turned down the third applicant for his age even though he was a student at Auburn. This is age discrimination and also illegal. And finally with our fourth applicant, even though he passed, they made him pay the entire year up front. Also illegal. The office is absolutely rude and disrespectful. Do not live here. The only plus is they have nice pools but it definitely isn't worth it. And they will make it nearly impossible to leave once you do sign.

name: Amber Hubbard
text:
DO NOT LIVE HERE! Overall, the living situation is not bad but dealing with them after I moved out was terrible. I left the apartment complex several months ago and am only now having to pay >$100 to them for a condition that was pre-existing to my residence in the apartment. I emailed them about it and not only were the staff members rude but they also refused to listen to me or do anything about it. At this point I am forced to pay this ridiculous fee in order to avoid being sent to collections.

The location is great but dealing with the staff is terrible!

name: Alyxandra Benedict
text: If you're looking for a scam look no further. In the three years I've been there, I moved into a dirty apartment, had to wait a month for them to fix a black mold issue caused by a leak from their appliance, had my catalytic converter stolen because they wouldn't use the security measures they advertised, was charged large quantities of money for "cleaning" an apartment they were renovating, and now they refuse to return my security deposit claiming that I never had to pay one (my bank statements say otherwise). This "luxury" they advertise is a cheap facade. The management is non-existent, leaving underpaid college students to clean up their messes and deal with the rightfully angry clientel. I havent once seen the manager and every time I try to communicate with him it's always been through an uninformed second party. No one on site knows anything and management likes to keep it that way, so getting things done or getting information is impossible. This is especially infuriating when they do renovations. They may give you one days notice to get things in order, but that's not so great when they chose the middle of a break to tell you to empty your livingroom for the flooring guys or risk your stuff getting broken, or waiting until after they pressure wash the building to tell you they may have accidentally wrecked anything loose on your deck because they forgot to tell you to bring it in. The only time anyone has ever really gotten along with The Connection is when they just accepted the exorbitant charges they tack on for services they refuse to provide without a care for getting their moneys worth.

name: Ashleigh Payne
text: It was nice when the old owners were here. The apartments are nice and I like the apartment itself but the new management is terrible. They raised rent, then decided to renovate and raised rent AGAIN to stay in my unit that was going to be renovated, then there was a big fiasco where they wouldn’t guarantee that I could stay in my unit but still had to pay the higher rent. Maintenance is okay but sometimes they seem like they hate their job and hate you. Today they shut the water off to the entire community at 10:45 and didn’t tell anyone until 11:15, after it was too late to fill up jugs to drink and wash hands. They said it’ll be off for a minimum of 5 hours but who knows with how things have been going. The whole point in living here was that it was decently cheap but now the connection doesn’t really even have that going for it anymore. Unfortunately I signed my lease for the next term when rent was lower so I’m stuck here, but when the lease is up, I’m out.

name: Jessica Doyle
text: Apartment came with no damages, and I feel like the price is reasonable for what you get. The amenities are nice, but I do wish the WiFi was more consistent.

name: Katherine Thompson
text: best value for the money and they made it really easy to sublease. The furniture that is offered in the furnished apartment is the best I've seen in the apartments I have rented through the years

name: Andrew Adkins
text: good apartment and staff, but maintenance is slow. Be warned though the manager was very hard to contact if you had any problems.

resp.text: Thank you for choosing us as your home and for taking the time to share your opinion with our future residents. You may contact our management office if needed directly at 334.821.3301 M-F 10-6, or email us at connectionauburn@achliving.com

name: Emily Hicks
text: Lived here for 3 years and am only moving out because I graduated. This complex has been the best!! The staff are helpful, the apartments are spacious and well priced, the amenities are great, there are so many positive things. We only had one bug problem the whole three years, and there were yellow jackets getting in the apartment somehow, but once we figured out where they were coming in the maintenance staff took care of it for us. Also, a lot of places in auburn aren't efficiently built and that makes your utilities higher, and here the utilities are super manageable. I have heard of people finding more critters in the first floor apartments, so I would suggest an upper floor. Moving to atlanta has been the worst, because I was spoiled with this place!!

name: Jacob
text: Maintenance sucks, parking sucks, management is decent. But you get 3 pools so it's okay right?

name: Katiann Scherer
text: Parking situation could be better but the pool and fully furnished apartments are awesome!

name: Chris Garrison
text: Fantastic staff! Super convenient!

resp.text: Thank you for the review, Chris! We are glad that you are so pleased with the staff!

name: Allison Martin
text: Staff is so friendly and there are always activities to get the residents involved. You will never have a chance to be bored because there are always activities around.

name: Kelsey Turner
text: It has been an amazing experience, the location is great, the staff is great, and the price is pretty great too.

name: MARGARET DANIELS
text: For a first timer in getting an apartment the experience was made easy and comforting, when you first arrived. On the plus side it made my other friends a little jealous.

name: Alexander Weeden
text: I would not recommend the connection to anyone. The included internet is god-awful, especially during fall and spring semesters. Maintenance requests are slow, and management is unfriendly (borderline hostile at points). They will charge you an arm and a leg for absolutely anything they can find wrong with the apartment after move out, even in the common areas. The front gate is either broken and kept wide open, or broken and closed (good luck with the keypad, did not work in the whole 2 years I lived there). The back gate has been chained shut or broken for almost a year now. Aesthetically nice grounds and a few good amenities like the pool area, but nowhere near enough parking for residents (especially during football season). For inspections, they will give you a 5 day time frame to expect a visit, but don't worry because they'll show up a week late anyways. If you can't find anywhere else to live, this is the perfect complex for you.

name: Jack Ryan
text: I'm not complaining about the apartments they are fine, but our experiences with the staff have been awful. Frustrating is all I'm going to say.

name: P R
text: If you're a minority, think about renting elsewhere! They favor white people and you will see that after living here for more than a week. My roommate and I are both minorities and they treat both of us unfairly. We have made repeated complaints and the staff in the office almost mock us, namely the assistant manager, Zac.

name: Maggie Owens
text: they are not even worthy of one star. if you're looking to live at a place that actually cares about you as an individual person, do not live here. this place is so huge...ALL they care about is money. and they will get it any possible way they can from you. they will knock on the door once then come in your apartment any time they want to. i complained because they knocked once then unlocked the door and walked in on my friend in her towel. so they told me it was in the agreement when i signed the lease that they can and will come into your apartment any time they want to. the college students who worked there were nice. but the managers are the rudest, meanest people i've ever had to deal with. when i moved units, the apartment i moved in to had black mold all over the walls, the kitchen had some sort of white film all over the cabnits, oven and microwave, the floor was filthy with hair, change and popcorn behind the couch. theres no way they even swept the floor. when i went to complain about the cleaning cost, i showed them pictures.. and they still wouldn't give me a refund. the cleaning cost was a couple hundred dollars. you will regret signing a lease here. biggest mistake i made while i was at Auburn.

resp.text: We regret that you have had an unpleasant experience. Resident satisfaction is extremely important to us. Please give us the opportunity to change your opinion. Your review is anonymous so we ask that you contact us to rectify your concerns. We can be reached at 334.821.3301 & community email at connectionauburn@achliving.com. The management office is open M-F 10-6. We look forward to improving your opinion!

name: Caitlyn Marshall
text: This place is horrible! Management is really what makes the stay bad because they never handle anything correctly or go by the rules. We've been waiting for months to get problems we've been having resolved and they still haven't done anything. The staff doesn't care about anything and are extremely rude! I've even tried to contact Asset Campus Housing and they never return any phone calls. You'll really start to hear a lot of bad reviews after you move here and then it will be too late. Please do yourself a favor and not move here because you definitely will regret it!

name: Wayne Smith
text: I cant believe how nice my apartment is for the amount Im paying! I love this place. The pools, basketball court and the fact that the mgmt. keeps so many activities going makes for the best place Ive ever lived. Im sad to graduate and have to move out. :-[

name: K LeeAnn
text: I hated staying here and that's saying a lot because of where I lived before moving here and at least they did exterminate regularly. If I could give a less than 1 star I would.

resp.text: Kendall, we feel badly that you were not happy and would like to make your experiences here enjoyable. Customer service is our priority and we will work diligently to ensure your happiness. You may contact our management office at 334.821.3301 or community email address at connectionauburn@achliving.com so that we can resolve any issues you may have had while living here. We are open M-F 10-6. We look forward to correcting your issues!

name: Carson Lewis
text: VERY friendly awesome staff here that is always willing to help no matter what! Customer service is their number one priority that they exceed in well!

name: Karin Frament
text: The gate never works and my catalytic converter was stolen during Spring Break!! $3000 worth of damage when they cut it off...2 incidents the same day and 5 Honda's the same week!!!!  Manager doesn't care and won't respond to complaints for lack of security!

name: Jordan Smith
text: I hate living here I can not wait to move out! The maintance staff is so awful! My toilet was clogged and needed to be snaked and they said that wasn't an emergency so they would get to it when they can. So I had to drive to the local Walmart to use the bathroom. If I could move out right now I would. Also they do not even read the roommate matching me and my roommate are like night and day and do not get along at all. The gym area is small and half the time non of the equipment works. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

name: Jessica Stewart
text: I have really enjoyed my first few months here at the Connection! The complex is kept in very good condition and the staff are very friendly!

name: Carl's Burgers
text: The connection is one of the worst properties in Auburn. The management is absolutely horrible and never responds to any maintenance requests or tenant needs. My apartment was infested with fleas upon moving in and several appliances were also broken. If you can help it don't live here.

resp.text: We regret that you have had an unpleasant experience. Resident satisfaction is extremely important to us. Please give us the opportunity to change your opinion. Your review is anonymous so we ask that you contact us to rectify your concerns. We can be reached at 334.821.3301 & community email at info@connectionauburn.com. The management office is open M-F 10-6. We look forward to improving your opinion!

name: Deron Decker
text: Serious issues with online rental payment.   Late charges seem to incorrectly calculated and there is no grace period at the beginning of the month.

resp.text:
Deron,

Thank you for your review.  The online portal is one of many options you have to pay rent.  Along with it, you can pay through mail or in the office with a check or money order.  Rent is due on the 1st of every month.  While there is not a grace period, late fees do not begin until the 4th of the month, meaning you have until the 3rd each month to avoid late fees.  Should you have any additional concerns, please e-mail info@connectionauburn.com or call 334-821-3301 and we will be happy to answer them.

name: Trent Carpenter
text: It's very peaceful and well organized

name: Mason A Palmer
text: Great people, great place, great amenities. The Connection is the place to go!

name: Sherry Hammond
text: Wifi never works, maintenance takes forever to fix things if they fix, front gate is always broke & the spa is not heated & is now referred to as a community pool

resp.text:
Sherry,

We are sorry to hear about your negative experience. If you have any internet issues, you will need to contact Single Digits at (877) 778-9283. They are happy to help you troubleshoot any problems you may be having! If you have any work order requests, please notify the office by email at info@connectionauburn.com or by phone at (334) 821-3301 and we will make sure any maintenance issues are addressed!

name: Emmi Da
text: Super nice and love it.

name: Aleah Wyatt
text: Love love love love love it here (:

name: Divy Dishant
text: Its nice.

resp.text: We are so happy that you're pleased with our community. Our priority is to provide excellent customer service, so thank you for taking the time to share your experience with our future residents. If you need anything, please don't hesitate to contact our management office. 334.821.3301 or email us at connectionauburn@achliving.com.

name: brandon white
text: Absolutely awful management.

name: Dakota Gregg
text: Horrible management, refuses to comply with resident requests

name: Mark Fernando
text: Management is bad, they lied to me for weeks while I waited thinking I was going to move in at the agreed date.

name: Kayla Maddox
text: It great!

name: Jocsán Rivera
text: The bomb dot com

name: blake evans
text: I pay good money to live here. The only people that care for anyone here is the people that work under management. I have more than once had issues with management and infact taken it without argument. I ask for one request ever in return. But instead of being about to talk to management personally, they decline my request to do so. It seems they do not have enough time to speak directly with their paying residents. Disgraceful.

name: Jordan DeLoney
text: The walls and ceilings are very thin and will not allow you like to study in your room if you need a quiet space. Their study rooms are also not an option because they are right below the gym. In addition, the Wifi is always out and there are problems with the hot water. I did not enjoy staying here.

resp.text: We’re sorry to hear about that! Please feel free to contact the Management Office or call our Customer Service Team at 512-732-1099 so we can discuss your review in detail. - Corporate Customer Service

name: Smoothiedude Dayton
text:
My daughter was a tenant for two years. All things considered, it was a good place to live. I do have three gripes that were never addressed.

1.) The biggest. There is no formal protocol in place if a tenant tests positive for CV-19. They say they can't ask a resident if they are positive and do nothing to safeguard the other "roommates" or their staff, for that matter. Thank goodness her roommate left and quarantined back in Atlanta.

2.) There is not a mechanism in place if a roommate decides to bring in pets and not tell the management team.  I complained on more than one occasion last spring, but, they did nothing to rid the unit of a dog and hamster.

3. I'm still waiting on my deposit to be returned. I have not received any indication of any outstanding balances and wonder if I will ever get my deposit. They were very adamant about getting the deposit initially.

resp.text: Thank you for your review. We know you have other housing options, and we appreciate that your daughter chose 160 Ross for two years. We’re sorry your daughter had a bad experience. We have policies for each one of your concerns and welcome the opportunity to speak with you via phone. If you’d like, please give the Management Office a call or contact the Customer Service Department at 512-732-1099 to discuss your review. Thank you. -Jessica L. [Customer Service]

name: Meleah Montgomery
text: It is a nice apartment with good amenities, but the WiFi is terrible. With some classes being remote this school year, it is sometimes impossible to get work done here because the WiFi barely works.

resp.text: Meleah, we’re sorry to hear about your issues with the Wifi! Please feel free to contact the Management Office or call our Customer Service Team at 512-732-1099 so we can discuss your review in detail. - Rachel K. [Customer Service]

name: Emily Dunlap
text: I want to start off by saying the manager there Bre Davis is absolutely amazing! She is super friendly and has went out of her way to help in anyway she can! I would highly recommend 160 Ross to anyone looking for great apartments in Auburn!

resp.text: Thank you for your great review !

name: robert jenning
text: This is probably one of the worst apartments in Auburn. Don’t rely on them to help your child or yourself in general. They will try to screw you over every way possible. Good thing they made a contract with Auburn University to be a “freshman dorm” because otherwise they wouldn’t have ANYONE living here. Do the best for yourself, and your child, and don’t live here. Find a more reliable and responsive management. It seems like a good deal, but there’s a reason for that...

resp.text: Robert, thank you for taking the time to leave us your feedback about 160 Ross. We value you as a customer and welcome the opportunity to discuss your concerns in more detail.  You may call the Management Office or contact the Customer Service Team at 512-732-1099 if you would like to discuss your review. - Rachel K. [Customer Service]

name: Anthony Hayes
text: Fantastic amenities and management always go the extra mile! Misty and Breanda are always such a joy to be around

resp.text: Thank you so much for your wonderful review !

name: trent ashoo
text: 5 stars for KEN, he is the absolute man! He’s got a ton of knowledge about the building and if he doesn’t know how to fix something he is resourceful and timely. The building building kinda sucks. We had a leak in the apartment and in the hall. GOOD THING KEN IS THE BOY!

resp.text:
Trent,
Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback. We're so happy to hear that Ken is resourceful and doing a great job. I'll make sure to pass along the kind words to him. - Lauren K.

name: KK L
text: The management and front desk staff have bent over backwards to help us. They have been professional, prompt and kind. As a a parent, we appreciate all that they did to help us out of a terrible situation at another apartment complex in August and got us in to an apartment the week that classes started (a day earlier than promised). Recently, they have been very helpful and straightforward renewing our lease for next year. The facilities and apartments are beautiful and safe and the team supporting the residents is top notch.

resp.text:
Hi,
That's what we like to hear, and we are glad we were able to help you all out this past August!  Thanks so much for the feedback - it's so appreciated. -Lauren K.

name: Alissa Heath
text: I have lived here for two years and it has been a very nice experience. I never had to wait more than an hour to get something fixed if something was broken in my apartment and also the management and workers at the front desk are always so sweet! It is also a plus to have everything so clean all the time compared to other complexes I have lived in before. I would recommend living here to anybody!

resp.text: Thanks so much for the kind words Alissa!  We wish you luck in your future career and will miss your smiling face when you graduate!

name: John Daily
text:
160 Ross are some snakes.
they told my roomates and I that if we did not resign when we did back in November the rates would be hundreds of dollars higher.  Here we are in August and they are offering free months of rent and rates $200 less a month for people that sign now. They tricked us and I would highly NOT recommend signing a lease with this apartment complex.

resp.text: Hi John, thanks for your feedback.  We know you have other housing options, and we appreciate that you chose 160 Ross. We’re sorry you’re unhappy with our current specials. 160 Ross strives to give our returning residents the best rates, but it sounds like we fell short.  If you’d like, please give the Management Office a call or contact the Customer Service Department at 512-732-1099 to discuss your review. Thank you - Caithn S. [Corporate Customer Service]

name: Bailey
text: The fire alarm will go off at any time (almost daily) for at least 30 minutes. It is such an ear-piercing sound and the staff has never apologized for it going off so many times. It also goes off very late, sometimes at 4AM. It is the most annoying thing I've ever had to deal with and they are doing NOTHING to fix it. Unacceptable. Walls are paper-thin and you can hear every single thing from your neighbors room. Neighbors from upstairs are even worse. If they are just walking around, it sounds like they are jumping on the floors as hard as they can. Don't fall victim to the "positive" reviews. Don't live here. There are better options

resp.text: Hey Baily, I'm sorry that you were experiencing issues with the fire alarm. This issue has been resolved but if you would like to discuss your experience further, please give our Management Office or Corporate Customer Service Team a call at 512-732-1099. - Rachel K. [Customer Service]

name: Beth Thomas
text:
PLEASE READ BEFORE YOU DECIDE.  I feel compelled to write this review to warn present and future renters/parents of the issues with leasing at 160 Ross. My son has rented from 160 Ross and is now in his 4th lease. As noted, the rent rises every year with no new updates inside or out. THIS IS NOT WHY I AM WRITING.
This year because the complex did not fully rent out my son is in a 4 bedroom apartment by himself. Some would think this is a great thing but be warned, regardless as to the number of un-rented bedrooms in the unit, the utilities for that unit are the responsibility of whomever is living there. His utility bill for June and July was over$160+/mo total.  He does not use or have access to the other 3 bedrooms. After several discussions the complex agreed to subsidize the other 3 rooms @ $20 each (which is part of their lease agreement). That is helpful but does not cover the full utilities for the apartment unused spaces. Less the subsidy his portion was $80+.  Since he has lived there for 3+ years and in the same room for the last 2+ years he knows what his utility bills averaged.  He has never paid over $30+/mo. I thought these were supposed to be individual leases and a shared utility bill. He has no option other than to sublet (HA! HA! like anyone would be ignorant enough to do this) or pay the higher utility bills for the remainder of his lease. 160 Ross chose not to put anyone in this apartment and instead optioned to fill up other apartments. He did not even know he was not going to have roommates till July of 2019, well past his time to get out of a lease that was signed back in Nov. of 2018.  When you get down to it 160 Ross has decided he was going to be alone in the apartment and would be subject to cover all the utilities over the paltry subsidy. As I said before I would think very carefully about moving yourself or your son/daughter into 160 Ross or any American Campus Facility given the treatment of the residents.

name: Elizabeth Taylor
text: The staff at 160 Ross provides such a warm and welcoming environment every time I walk into the office. Misty and Lauren do such a great job at what they do and you can tell they really care about not only the property but every single one of the residents! I highly suggest checking out 160 Ross!

name: Tristan Hazebrook
text: I’ve lived here for the past two years and loved it. The amenities are great and there’s always fun stuff going on for residents. The pool is perfect and stays in the sun super long.

resp.text: Hey Tristan, we are so glad you are our resident!! Resident's like you make 160 Ross an AMAZING place to live! - Lauren K

name: Tatom Moore
text: I’ve lived here for 2 years & I’m living here next year because I absolutely love it! Lauren & Misty & the entire rest of the staff are always super helpful. I also love the amenities & the covered parking!

name: Andrew Lipscomb
text: Awesome place to live! Work orders are fulfilled super quick. The wifi has been upgraded recently and is very fast. I can stream 4k video with no buffering, and I've never had any issues while playing online video games. they take care of all the things that you wouldn't otherwise think about. For example, I've never seen a single bug in my apartment, and that is absolutely not the case for my friends living in other apartments. Everyone who works here is very approachable, knowledgeable, and dedicated.

resp.text: Hey Andrew, we are so glad we are able to take care of any issues quickly for you! I'll pass along the praise as well to our maintenance staff for all of their hard work. - Lauren K

name: colin rossi
text: Overall my experience living at 169 hasn’t been great, overages are made up and overcharged every month along with countless other issues the complex has.  However the one plus side has been the maintenance man Ken Howard.  Anytime we have had an issue Ken always comes through and does above and beyond what we requested.

resp.text: Hi Colin, Thank you for taking the time to leave a review. Thanks for the shout out to our Maintenance Tech, Ken! We're sorry to hear that you are getting overcharged and that the overages are not being clearly explained to you. If you would like to discuss the charges on your account, we're here to help. Give our Management Office our Customer Service Team a call at 512-732-1099 to discuss your review. Thank you - Caithn S. [Corporate Customer Service]

name: Noelle Johnson
text: Nice and friendly staff!! Quick to complete work orders. Environment is kept clean and fun to live in! Lauren at the front is awesome!

resp.text: Thanks, Noelle for the shout out! I'll also pass along the praises to our maintenance team! - Lauren K

name: Davi
text:
Update, Missy resolved the issue, she handled it well. They still need to amend their contract with the towing company so that it does not grant so much  autbority to the towing company, their interpretation  of towable vehicles is bias.
I am dumbfounded that this company would allow a towing company to enter a permit only garage and tow the cars. According to Auburn Express towing, they have a deal with the complex to tow any car that does not display both the hang tag and decal to their satisfaction. One of the primary reasons students have cars is for their safety. This compromises their safety, because it subjects them to unsafe alternatives when their vehicles are wrongfully towed. I would understand if the complex issued warnings regarding the accurate placement of decals. I wonder what incentives the towing company offers the complex to give them such liberal access to a permit only garage. I am angry that my child, a resident, was left vulnerable.

resp.text: Hi Davi. Thank you for sharing your sentiments about our towing policies. We have the contract to tow in place to avoid illegal parking or non-residents and visitors taking up spaces. If we don't have those rules in place, our residents are inconvenienced by outsiders taking their spots. If you have suggestions on how to avoid this, please feel free to contact the management office or customer service at 512-732-1099. Thank you. - Taniya R. [Corporate Customer Service]

name: Molly Cassidy
text: I’ve lived here for a year now and it’s an awesome complex! great amenities and very helpful office staff! an awesome place if you want to be close to campus!!

resp.text: We're so glad you love calling 160 Ross your home. Stop by our office anytime you have any questions. -Lauren K

name: Alice Baker
text: Lived here for 3 years and absolutely loved it! The workers are very helpful and maintence requests are complete in a short period of time. Pool and amenities are great.

name: Gabby Burns
text: I have lived here for 3 years and have loved it! It is a great place to live with great amenities!! The staff is always so helpful!

name: Piper
text: 160 ross has amazing and friendly staff. The amenities are great and are always a fun time. Shout out Amelia law for being so amazing at the front desk!

resp.text: Thank you, Piper! Positive feedback from our residents is always so appreciated - we'll certainly pass your shout out along to Amelia. -Lauren K

name: Tori Warren
text: I have truly enjoyed living here in 160 Ross.  Why? Because of the wonderful amenities, helpful staff, and exciting neighbors.  I have had no real problems with 160.  However, I do wish the lighting was brighter.  Other than that I love 160!! Would recommend.

name: Jackenstein
text: Many of times have I hated living here. The walls are as thin as can be and people are always partying loud enough for you to hear then across both courtyards 3 nights a week. The parking deck is dangerous to drive in and is running out of space to park since few residents are willing to pay for the “reserved” parking at $25 a month. I just got towed since I didn’t have my hang tag on my car for about 48 hours while being parked in a spot that I’m normally allowed to park in. This happened without my knowledge since I was out of town for the weekend. It happened even though I had my sticker that said my car’s allowed to park in the deck in addition to them having my license plate and description of my car on file so they know the owner of the car lives here! You’d think that would be enough or that someone would have the decency to let me know my car has been towed! The hallways are always trashed and cleaned on Friday morning before they get messed up again Friday and Saturday night. Resident activities are a waste of money and the good ones require you to show up a good amount of time before it starts to even allow you to get so much as a chicken biscuit. Finally, the wifi is either not working or acting like it works while still not working. All of this can be yours for the hefty price tag of 12 payments of $749 a month not including the skyrocketing prices of utilities. The price keeps going up even though the value keeps going down. Bottom line, you’d be better off elsewhere in more ways than one!

resp.text: Hi Jackson. We appreciate your feedback and we’re sorry for any frustration you may have experienced with all of the issues you listed.  Please feel free to contact our Management Office or the Customer Service Department at 512-732-1099 to discuss your concerns in detail.

name: Anna Sleeman
text: I love living here! There is always cool activities like food trucks and the pool is sweet! Great location!

resp.text: Thanks, Anna! We try to make sure our resident events are always a ton of fun! - Lauren K

name: Stephanie Freeman
text: I generally enjoy living here, they always have fun events going on and free food for different things as well. Our apartment unfortunately flooded but the staff was really helpful and nice and was able to get us back into our apartment very efficiently. I would recommend living here ! Also very easy to get to university by either walking or the transit.

name: Lauren Hurston
text: I have had a great experience living here. The staff is nice and friendly and very helpful if you ever have questions. They always have events going on and free food etc. for the residents. The pool and workout room are extremely nice and the game room is an awesome study break. I really love living here and would definitely recommend it to anyone!

name: Ally Douglas
text: If I could give them -5 stars I would. 160 was awful. I could have lived through the paper thin walls, floors, and ceilings if it weren't for the management. They tried to fine us for a noise complaint when that night 1 person was home. The only reason complaints were answered for our unit was because the girls below us worked at 160 which shows the poor management style and unprofessional manner they operated in. Will not be returning next year.

resp.text: Hey Ally, thanks for taking the time to leave us a review. I'm sorry to hear that you had issues with Management and that you had a noise violation that you were unable to dispute. Please give our Corporate Customer Service Team a call if you would like to further discuss your experience. We would love to see how we can help. Customer Service can be reached at 512-732-1099 or CustomerService@AmericanCampus.com. - Rachel K. [Cusotmer Service]

name: Elias Hiskey
text:
great amenities, a nice workout room and good pool.
solid location, easy to walk to campus or downtown
fun environment

resp.text: We love all of these things about our community too! Thanks for the review - Lauren K

name: Eddie Reyes
text: DO NOT BE SCAMMED BY 160 ROSS!! Please avoid this place at all costs. Do not fall for the nice rooms that they advertise. Walls are paper thin and the people that live here no respect for others and play their music as loud as possible and as late as possible. If you live in front of one of the roads prepare for a lot of traffic noise that wakes you up in the morning before your alarm does. And don't expect to come into a nice clean room when you first move in, instead expect it to be dusty, dirty, and dark. I wish I had seen the bad reviews before I signed my $759 12 month lease that is now being advertised for $649. And apparently all the good reviews are from people who were told they would get free food if they put a 5 star review on here. Yikes!

resp.text: Hi Eddie, We’re sorry to hear about your bad experience at 160 Ross. We continually strive to exceed customer expectations with our units, however, based on your review it sounds as though we fell short.   Please feel free to contact our Management Office or the Customer Service Department at 512-732-1099 to discuss your concern in detail. Thank you - Caithn S. [Corporate Customer Service]

name: Carly Porep
text: The staff is amazing!!! The are always so friendly when I walk inside and always willing to help with anything.

name: Kelly Andreone
text: I’ve lived here for the past year and it’s great! I love being so close to campus!

resp.text: That's what we like to hear. Thanks so much for the feedback, and we LOVE being close to campus too. — Lauren K

name: Shelby Gustin
text: 160 ross is a super fun place to live and they take care of everything in a timely manner! Lauren’s the best!

resp.text: Yay! We love our residents, and positive feedback is always so appreciated.-Lauren K

name: sam jones
text: one time someone threw up in the stairwell and it wasn't cleaned for two weeks. also the pool in consistently green. the gates are often broken. they tell you the utility bill is usually $10 or less but it is much more expensive than that. DONT LIVE HERE

resp.text: Hi Sam, wow, that is unfortunate to hear that a mess was not cleaned up for a few weeks. It's always important to contact the office so that it may be addressed. We’re sorry that you had a bad experience.  Please give the Management Office or Customer Service Team a call, so we can discuss your concerns in detail.  The Customer Service Team can be reached at 512-732-1099. - Rachel K. [Customer Service]

name: Caroline Baehr
text: 160 Ross is not the place for you if you have sensitive ears. The walls are paper thin, you can hear everything from all directions(outside and inside). We got over 10 noise complaints because the people under us worked here, 8/10 of those were from us simply walking around.  The people above us are extremely loud, but we never called a noise complaint because we understood that the walls were so thin. The study rooms are loud because they are right underneath the gym so you can hear treadmills if you are trying to study. Simply don't live here if you can't handle a bunch of noise. 100% not renewing our lease.

resp.text: Hey Caroline! I'm really sorry to hear that you had issues with the neighbors below you and that you felt the walls and floors weren't sound proof. We appreciate your feedback. Please give our Corporate Customer Service Team a call if you would like to further discuss your review. We can be reached at 512-732-1099. - Rachel K. [Customer Service]

name: Lauren Brands
text: 160 has been awesome! Both management and maintenance are great. Anytime you have an issue they always work to do everything that they can! Although you do live in close proximity to your neighbors (just the nature of being in any apartment complex) the staff has measured in place to help out anytime there are any issues. Was originally worried about the negative reviews before signing my lease, but so glad I took them with a grain of salt. Glad to be a part of this community!

resp.text:
Lauren,

We are glad you are a part of our community too! Thank you for your review. It’s always our goal at 160 Ross to provide the best customer service possible. Feel free to contact our office if you need anything and once again thank you!

name: D. East Cobb Mom
text:
We have been renters for one year in Ross and wish now we had never entered the front door.  Our experience is the same as a previous poster John Daily.

We were charged rent August 1st but only allowed in August 15th. The room was not freshly painted and we cannot understand the delay.

Only having lived there a few weeks, we were pressured to sign a new annual lease for the following year with an increase to the rate. Concerned and nervous, we signed a new lease in October with a new monthly rate for their cheapest room at 759.00.  This same room has been renting for 649.00 since April and they now allow for ten month terms.  We feel taken advantage of and very upset that  no one in the office will rent us our room at the current rate.  Beware of Ross, a lot of pressure, they are salesmen not community assistants.

resp.text: Hello there, Thank you for taking the time to leave us your feedback. We're sorry to hear that you are unhappy. 160 Ross values you as a customer, and we welcome the opportunity to discuss your concerns with the rental rates in more detail.  You may call the Management Office or contact the Customer Service Team at 512-732-1099 if you would like to discuss your review.  Thank you - Caithn S. [Corporate Customer Service]

name: Katie
text: I would not recommend living at 160 Ross. Like everyone has previously stated, the walls are extremely thin. I can hear the conversations of the people who live beside me, above me, below me, and in the courtyard. The parking garage is also extremely tight, and people drive recklessly. If I come home past 7 PM, I can only find parking on the top floor. Further, if I ever have any problems such as noise complaints or maintenance issues, I no longer bother reporting them knowing how they’ve completely ignored or mishandled my complaints in the past. 160 Ross seemed like a nice place to live in originally because it’s proximity to campus and it’s amenities, but after living here for over a year now I’d highly suggest anyone looking to live here to consider looking elsewhere. Lastly, all the positive comments posted a month ago were only posted because those who did post positive comments could receive free food.

resp.text: Katie, We're sorry that you were disappointed with your experience. Please reach out to our office at 334-332-9736 - we'd love to discuss your situation in detail and make it right. - Lauren K.

name: Tyler Dollar
text: I've lived here since it open and I love it for what you get you really pay a good price considering how expensive other places are for the same style of living. My roommates are great and we all renewed to live here for our third year

name: Brenna Fowler
text: I absolutely love living here! It is a close walk to campus, and parking is not an issue at all (it is now). Definitely recommend checking this place out if you're looking into living off-campus! Just kidding, they upped the rates $60.

name: Cameron Humphrey
text: I like this place. close to campus (close enough to walk). Prices are iffy but understandable. The staff is cool, the people that live here are cool. Overall a nice place to live.

name: Catie Asarch
text: 160 is a great place to live! We love it!!! It’s close to campus and a perfect place!

resp.text: Thank you. We love our 160 Ross residents, and your feedback means a lot to us.-Lauren K

name: Amber Jackson
text: I enjoyed the activities and amenities that 160 Ross provided; however, the roommate matching system needs improvement.

resp.text:
Hi Amber,
Thanks so much for the feedback - it's so appreciated. -Lauren K

name: Curtis Mitchell
text: I've lived here since 160 Ross opened and I must say.. Its LIT!! I absolutely love this place. the game room compared to the other apartments I have visited is simply awesome. The rooms are great and considering I only have to pay rent because my utilities are included is a big plus. The only knock I have on this place is parking. Yea we have a parking deck but its really tight. also Their isn't enough space for my guests to park so they run the risk of getting towed a lot . but other than that, the place is great!

name: Maddy Bergeron
text: There have been multiple problems with my apartment. To get management to take the issues seriously usually a parent has to become involved, even then it was a slow going process to get the problem's fixed correctly and according to code. Overall it has nice amenities  and is close to campus so it evens out to be okay in the end.

resp.text: Hi Maddy, It is unfortunate to hear of your bad experience.  We strive to continually exceed customer expectations, however, based on your experience it sounds as though we fell short.   Please feel free to contact our Customer Service Department at 512-732-1099 to discuss your Google review.

name: Jacob Locke
text: For the past two years, my experience at 160 Ross has been bliss in comparison to other apartments I've lived at.  The rent is high compared to most places in Auburn, but the amenities, accommodations, and proximity to downtown make up for the difference.  Management has always been kind and quick to respond to problems.  It is very nice to have secure garage parking!  My only complaint would be the guest parking situation.  25 guest spots is nowhere near enough parking for the ~650 residents that live here.

name: Jessica
text: Management is absolutely awful to their employees. They make their workers want to quit almost daily. Never known management to act like such teenagers. They ignore continuous complains about loud neighbors even with evidence of loud bangs and screams. They never go to the next step to get them to stop the loudness. The walls are paper thin, if you want to listen to your roommates phone call crying to their boyfriend at 3 am you’re in luck. Or the person next to you tapping their desk chair against the wall for two straight hours. And nothing is done about it. Either the people here are jerks and refuse to answer their door, or no one is sent to handle it in the first place. They will say they’ll take care of it but record absolutely nothing of the issue so each call is basically call #1 and the neighbors are never punished. Garage is a crash zone, sorority girls and guys in big trucks fly around the corner with no regards as to who may be coming. No mirrors to see around the corners. If you live here, get top floor so you can’t hear the circus above you. Not nearly enough guest parking and half of it for future residents, you WILL get towed. They lock every single door at night so there’s no way to get in, and have even taken handles off the outside of the doors.

resp.text: Hey Jessica, thank you for your review. We take your concerns very seriously and will pass along your feedback. I'm sorry that you have not had a good experience with the onsite Management resolving your noise complaints. Please give our Corporate Customer Service Team a call at 512-732-1099 to discuss your review further. We are here to help! - Rachel K. [Customer Service]

name: Miranda LaTourette
text: Living at 160 is a different kind of living experience, Its not like living on campus but it has its own way of making you feel as if you do. They always have games, events, and free food to entertain you. I love that so many of my friends live here, therefore we can go work out,goto the pool, or hangout on the green space all in the convenience of my home. Its just convenient way to socialize, live near campus, and meet new people. Although, Ive had a few issues with my living situation such as a pipe bust which caused flooding my apartment due to that and a few little things like lighting issues, management has worked well with me to address and find a solution to the problems.

name: David Marinello
text: The living room space and the Kitchen for the rooms were nice, but for the most part, that was the only nice things. The bedrooms are not large enough to warrant the price of the rent, the parking garage is a madhouse and should have been way bigger than it is, and the halls are uninviting and the layout is confusing. Also, the management is not very good and is poorly run. It is flashy, its an okay temporary place but I do not recommend living there very long.

resp.text: We appreciate your feedback and we are sorry for any frustration you may have experienced.  Please feel free to contact our Customer Service Department at 512-732-1099 to discuss your Google review.

name: lyndsey
text: If you are looking at the most relevant reviews and they are all 5 stars it is because 160 management pushes the good reviewes to the top so you will see them and sign but in reality no one wants to sign here anymore because it is the worst apartment complex in auburn. And the only good reviews on here are from a month ago and that is because they were giving out free food if you wrote a good review. If you are thinking of living here because it is close to campus and has great amenities, DO NOT LIVE HERE. 160 Ross was made fast and cheap. The walls are thin, you can hear the person above you, below you, and beside you, along with people walking in the halls. If you have a balcony, then good luck because you will hear people partying by the pool until early in the morning. and if you complain, they wont listen unless you tell them every day for a month. the doors to get in building are broken except for two. and the security guards will open the door for ANYONE. and when it is hot outside, the fire alarm will go off daily. It is now the fifth day in a row that the fire alarm has gone off in the morning. The rent amount goes up every month and i now pay 1000 a month. People throw up in the hallways and it is not cleaned up for weeks. Yes, 160 has a pool and gym but so does the Rec Center which is free for students and is way better than the pool and gym at 160. The wifi here will also randomly cut off and wont turn back on for a while. and the study rooms here are a joke! And they wont stop calling you to renew your lease after you have told the you wont renew 5 times. Also dont expect to park on the floor you live on if you get here past 7 pm and if you do park in the parking deck, be cautious because it is a CRASH ZONE! everyone drives fast and you cant see when you are turning the corner. also they forget to call pest control and roaches will appear in your freshly and weekly cleaned kitchen. walking to campus was enjoyable until construction started and now you have to walk on the street. If you call maintenance, dont except them to knock when they come. They have the key so they will walk right in, even if you are in the shower. another problem with privacy is that of you leave your blinds open, you are able to see directly into the whole room even if they are all the way across the courtyard. Also if you ever except to have guests, they will not find any parking. And the "resident activities" are always something random and scheduled in the middle of the day when everyone has class. I would have rather lived in a dorm than lived here!

resp.text: Hey Lyndsey, we greatly appreciate you as a resident and I'm sorry that you're unhappy with 160 Ross. There are a lot of things you brought up in your review that we would like to discuss further with you. It is our goal to provide the best experience possible, and we want to do better in the future. Customer Service can be reached at 512-732-1099 or CustomerService@AmericanCampus.com. - Rachel K. [Customer Service]

name: Ryan Hill
text:
If you are considering living at 160 Ross, do yourself a favor and don't. You can either trust me and start looking for other places or feel free to read about 160 Ross:

160 Ross puts on a facade that they care about their residents and keeping everything running smoothly but a group of monkeys could run 160 better than the management does currently. You will never speak with a manager, they always send out the young kids to deliver their messages because it's usually is not what you want to hear and they don't have the spine to come out and say it for themselves so they always have others speak on their behalf. And when you call to speak with a manager, they are out of their office and won't be back for a few days. And then they are supposed to be back, they're "out of the office" again.

I understand that the employees at 160 can come into the residents rooms if they have a reason but a little bit of notice would be nice. I have been getting out of the shower and had a 160 employee walk into my room without knocking. If they do knock on the front door, it's after they have already unlocked the door and began to open it.

When it comes to maintenance, don't expect anything to ever get done. Our living room fan had water leaking through it from the ceiling and they came to take the fan down and fix the leak but they left our fan on the ground outside for about a month before we had to call again to get them to put it back up on the ceiling.
